src: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.
mt: Ukumbusho wa mapenzi ulikuwa na sehemu kubwa ya utambuzi wa utamaduni, iliyotokana na wanasayansi kama Goethe, Fichte, na Schlegel. Katika mazingira ya Ukumbusho wa Mapenzi, jangwa liliathiri watu, na kwa muda, desturi na utamaduni iliyohusiana na jangwa hilo ilipatikana, na hizi, kwa kushirikiana na mahali pa jamii, zilikuwa bora kuliko sheria za kawaida zilizotolewa.
ref: Uroma ulikuwa na kipengele kikubwa cha maamuzi ya kitamaduni yaliyochochewa na waandishi kama vile Goethe, Fichte na Schlegel. Katika muktadha wa Uroma, jiografia ilifinyanga watu, na kwa mpito wa wakati mila na tamaduni zilizohusiana na jiografia zilizuka, na hizi, zikiwa zinapatana na hali ya jamii, zilikuwa bora kuliko sheria zilizolazimishwa kiholela.

src: "Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has ""effects"" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned. For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads. However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies."
mt: "Kutambulisha kwa teknolojia ni neno ambacho kinajumuisha mifano mengi ya mawazo katika mawazo, kutoka kwa mifano ya kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na kushughulikia na k
ref: "Uainishaji wa kiufundi ni kishazi ambacho hujumuisha maoni anuai katika mazoezi, kutoka teknolojia shinikizi, au maendeleo ya kiteknolojia katika dhana kuwa hatma ya binadamu huendeshwa na mantiki ya msingi inayohusishwa na sheria za kisayansi na udhihirisho wake katika teknolojia. Tafsiri nyingi za udhibitisho wa kiteknolojia zinashirikisha maoni mawili ya jumla: kwamba maendeleo ya teknolojia yenyewe hufuata njia zaidi ya ushawishi wa kitamaduni au kisiasa, na teknolojia hiyo kwa upande ina ""athari"" kwa jamii ambazo ni za asili, badala ya hali ya kijamii. Kwa mfano, mtu anaweza kusema kwamba motokaa hupelekea ukuzaji wa barabara. Hata hivyo, mfumo wa kitaifa wa barabara hufai kiuchumi kwa magari machache tu, kwa hivyo mbinu mpya za uzalishaji zinakuzwa ili kupunguza gharama ya umiliki wa magari. Umiliki wa magari kwa wingi pia hupelekea matukio mengi ya ajali za barabarani, ambazo hupelekea uvumbuzi wa mbinu mpya katika matibabu za kutengeneza miili iliyovunjika."

src: "The ""up bow"" mark looks like a V and the ""down bow mark"" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side. Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow. An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive. Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected."
mt: "Njia ya ""up bow"" inavyoonekana ni kama V na njia ya ""down bow mark"" ni kama kipande cha kisanduku au kipande cha kisanduku kinachopotea sehemu yake chini. Up inamaanisha kwamba unapaswa kuanza katika tipi na kupanda njia ya kisanduku, na down inamaanisha kwamba unapaswa kuanza katika frog (ambapo mkono wako unavyoendeshwa kisanduku) na kupanda njia ya kisanduku. Njia ya up-bow kwa kawaida inaweza kutoa nje saa yenye nguvu nyingi, wakati njia ya down-bow inaweza kutoa nje saa yenye nguvu nyingi na ni kama ya kujitetea. Uweze kuchagiza nje njia zako za kisanduku, lakini ufahamu njia za kisanduku zilizochapishwa zipo kwa sababu ya kisa cha muziki, hivyo zipo kwa sababu zinapaswa kubaki.
ref: "Alama ya ""gubeti la juu"" inaonekana kama V na ""alama ya gubeti la chini"" kama kibanio au mraba unaokosa upande wake wa chini. Juu inamaanisha unapaswa kuanzia nchani na kusukuma uta, na chini inamaanisha unafaa kuanzia kwenye frog (mahali ambapo mkono wako unashikilia uta) na kuvuta uta. Upinde wa juu kwa kawaida huzalisha sauti tulivu, huku upinde wa chini ukiwa na nguvu na ni imara zaidi. Jisikie huru kuandika kwa penseli alama zako, lakini kumbuka alama za kuinama zilizochapwa ziko kwa sababu ya kimziki, kwa hivyo yafaa ziheshimiwe."

src: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands in locomotion or bearing weight or swinging through the trees. The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the hand's use for bearing weight in knuckle walking. The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges. Fossil hand bones two million to three million years old reveal this shift in specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.
mt: Kabla ya wanyama wengine, wanyama wadogo wanaotumia mikono yao katika harakati au kupumzika au kupanda miti. Mikono ya kipunjani cha kipunjani ni sawa na kipunjani, kwa sababu mikono yake yanatumika kwa kupumzika kwa kipunjani. Mikono ya binadamu ni chache kuliko kipunjani, na phalanges zake zinaundwa. Mifugo ya mawe ya miaka milioni mitatu hadi mitatu ya kwanza yanavyoonyesha mabadiliko ya kipaji cha mikono kutoka harakati kwa kupumzika.
ref: Tofauti na nyani wengine, hominidi hawatumii mikono yao kwa kutembea, kubebea uzito au kubembea kwenye miti. Mkono na mguu wa sokwe ni sawa kwa ukubwa na urefu, kuonyesha matumizi ya mkono kwa kubeba uzito katika kutembea kwa konzi. Mkono wa binadamu ni mfupi kuliko mguu, na una mifupa minyoofu zaidi.. Visukuku vya mifupa ya mikono vilivyo na miaka milioni mbili hadi milioni tatu vinafunua haya mabadiliko ya utaalam wa mkono kutoka kwa kuusongesha na kuutumia.

src: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed. Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation. Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.
mt: Utafiti wa karne ya 20 umefanya kuonekana kwamba kuna mawimbi mawili ya uvumbuzi wa kigenetika: mawimbi ya kawaida na ya kawaida. Uvumbuzi wa kigenetika unavyoongezewa, na ushindani unavyoondolea, unavyoondolea mawimbi ya uvumbuzi wa kawaida kutoka mawimbi ya uvumbuzi wa kawaida. Segregati na recombination unavyoang'aa uvumbuzi kati ya mawimbi mawili kila kipindi.
ref: Utafiti wa karne ya ishirini umeonyesha kwamba kuna makundi mawili ya utofauti wa jeni: fiche na zilizoelezewa. Mabadiliko huongeza tofauti za kimaumbile, na uchaguzi huyaondoa katika mkusanyiko wa tofauti zilizoonyeshwa. Mabadiliko ya uchangaji ya utengaji na uchanganyaji tena huku na huko kati ya vidimbwi hivyo viwili kwa kila kizazi.

src: "Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources. Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."
mt: "Kwenye savanna, ni vigumu kwa primate na mfumo wa usogezaji kama huo wa binadamu kufikia mahitaji yake ya asidi amino kutoka kwa madhumuni ya mimea. Zaidi, kufa kwa hivyo ni na athari za kudhuru, ugonjwa na hatimaye kifo. Madhumuni yanayotumika kwa kasi zaidi ni protini zinazotokana katika majani na legume, lakini hizi ni vigumu kwa primate kama sisi kudondoka isipokuwa zinazotengenezwa. Katika hali nyingine, chakula cha wanyama (wadudu, wadudu, mayai) hupatikana kwa kasi na ni vigumu kwa primate kudondoka. Kwa sababu zote, hatuwezi kutaka kujaribu kama wazazi wetu walitengeneza mbinu zao kwa njia ya kama wadudu wanaoendesha kwenye savanna leo."
ref: Nje kwenye savana, ni vigumu kwa wanyama wakuu waliyo na mfumo wa kuyeyusha chakula tumboni kama wa binadamu kutoshelezeza mahitaji ya tindikali-za-amino zao kutoka kwa vifaa vya mimea vilivyomo Waaidha, kukosa kufanya hivyo kuna matokeo mazito: udidimiaji wa ukuaji, utapiamlo, na hatimaye kifo. Rasilimali za mimea zinazofikiwa kwa urahisi zingekuwa protini zinazopatikana katika majani na kunde, lakini hizi ni ngumu kwa wale wa kundi la mammalia wa hali ya juu kama sisi kusaga isipokuwa kama zimepikwa. Kwa kulinganisha, vyakula vya wanyama (siafu, mchwa, mayai) si kwamba vinameng’enywa kwa urahisi tu, lakini pia hutoa protini zenye kiwango kikubwa ambazo zina asidi muhimu za amino. Mambo yote yakizingatiwa, hatupaswi kushangaa kama wahenga wetu walitatua “shida yao ya protini” kwa njia sawa na zile nyani wa savanna hufanya leo.

Kwa sababu zote, hatuwezi kutaka kujaribu kama wazazi wetu walitengeneza mbinu zao kwa njia ya kama wadudu wanaoendesha kwenye savanna leo."
ref: Nje kwenye savana, ni vigumu kwa wanyama wakuu waliyo na mfumo wa kuyeyusha chakula tumboni kama wa binadamu kutoshelezeza mahitaji ya tindikali-za-amino zao kutoka kwa vifaa vya mimea vilivyomo Waaidha, kukosa kufanya hivyo kuna matokeo mazito: udidimiaji wa ukuaji, utapiamlo, na hatimaye kifo. Rasilimali za mimea zinazofikiwa kwa urahisi zingekuwa protini zinazopatikana katika majani na kunde, lakini hizi ni ngumu kwa wale wa kundi la mammalia wa hali ya juu kama sisi kusaga isipokuwa kama zimepikwa. Kwa kulinganisha, vyakula vya wanyama (siafu, mchwa, mayai) si kwamba vinameng’enywa kwa urahisi tu, lakini pia hutoa protini zenye kiwango kikubwa ambazo zina asidi muhimu za amino. Mambo yote yakizingatiwa, hatupaswi kushangaa kama wahenga wetu walitatua “shida yao ya protini” kwa njia sawa na zile nyani wa savanna hufanya leo.

src: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity. Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members. The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors. Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.
mt: Subkultura zinazunguka kwa wale wanaoamini kama wao, ambao wanaona kuwa wao wamejichukia na kifungu cha kijamii, na kwa hivyo wanaanzisha kujitambua. Subkultura zinaweza kuwa tofauti kwa sababu ya umri, kabila, kipindi, mahali, na au jinsia ya wanachama. Sababu zinazotaka kufanya subkultura kuwa tofauti zinaweza kuwa lugha, aina ya utamaduni, dini, siasa, kimapenzi, au kifungu cha kijamii, au zipo zote. Wanachama wa subkultura mara nyingi wanashiriki kwa njia ya aina ya utamaduni, ambayo inajumuisha fasheni, mawaido, na lugha.
ref: Utamaduni mdogo huwaleta pamoja watu walio wa mafikira sawa na ambao wanahisi kuwa wametengwa na viwango vya kijamii na kuwaruhusu kuendeleza hisia za utambulisho. Vikundi vidogo vya tamaduni vinaweza kuwa vya kipekee kwa sababu ya umri, kabila, daraja, eneo, na/au jinsia ya washiriki. Sifa zinazofanya utamaduni mdogo kuwa wa kipekee huenda zikawa za kilugha, kiurembo, kidini, kisiasa, kijiografia au mchanganyiko wa vipengele. Wanachama wa utamaduni mdogo mdogo kwa mara nyingi huashiria uanachama wao kupitia mitindo ya kipekee ambayo ni pamoja na mitindo ya kimavazi, tabia na lugha.

src: Children develop an awareness of race and racial stereotypes quite young and these racial stereotypes affect behavior. For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.
mt: Watoto wanapata fahamu ya rangi na stereotipia za rangi kama wachanga sana na stereotipia hizi zinazitukana na tabia. Kwa mfano, watoto wanaoona na kuaminiwa kuwa wana asili ya kikabila ambacho kinaelekezwa kuwa si kikubwa katika shule, wanaoamua kuwa si kikubwa katika shule baada ya kuona stereotipia ya kikabila ambacho wanaoaminiwa kuwa wana asili yake.
ref: Watoto hukuza ufahamu wa utaifa na kasumba za utaifa wakiwa wangali wachanga na kasumba hizo za utaifa huathiri tabia. Kwa mfano, watoto ambao wanashirikishwa na uchache wa kabila wanaodhaniwa kuwa hawafanyi vizuri shuleni huwa hawafanyi vizuri shuleni mara tu wanapogundua juu ya dhana linalohusishwa na kabila zao.

src: "One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up. Such children are called ""feral"" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment. Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away. Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own. When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans."
mt: "Moja ya njia za kawaida za kutumia kuelezea umuhimu wa ushirika ni kutumia kifungu cha wale wanaoendelea kwa sababu ya kutokubaliwa, kutokufikiri au kutokubaliwa kwa wale wanaoendelea kwa sababu ya ugonjwa wa kiroho au ugonjwa wa kingono. Wale wanaoendelea kwa sababu ya kutokubaliwa, kutokufikiri au kutokubaliwa kwa wale wanaoendelea kwa sababu ya ugonjwa wa kiroho au ugonjwa wa kingono wanaitwa wanaoendelea kwa sababu ya kutokubaliwa, kutokufikiri au kutokubaliwa kwa wale wanaoendelea kwa sababu ya ugonjwa wa kiroho au ugonjwa wa kingono. Wanaoendelea kwa sababu ya kutokubaliwa, kutokufikiri au kutokubaliwa kwa wale wanaoendelea kwa sababu ya ugonjwa wa kiroho au ugonjwa wa kingono wanaitwa wanaoendelea kwa sababu ya kutokubaliwa, kutokufikiri au kutokubaliwa kwa wale wanaoendelea kwa sababu ya ugonjwa wa kiroho au ugonjwa wa kingono. Wanaoendelea kwa sababu ya kutokubaliwa, kutokufikiri au kutokubaliwa kwa wale wanaoendelea kwa sababu ya ugonjwa wa kiroho au ugonjwa wa kingono wanaitwa wanaoendelea kwa sababu ya kutokubaliwa, kutokufikiri au kutokubaliwa kwa wale wanaoendelea kwa sababu ya ugonjwa wa kiroho au ugonjwa wa kingono. Wanaoendelea kwa sababu ya kutokubaliwa, kutokufikiri au kutokubaliwa kwa wale w
ref: "Mojawapo ya mbinu maarufu zinatozumiwa kuonyesha umuhimu wa kushirikiana ni kutumia mifano michache sikitishi ya watoto ambao, kupitia mapuuza, mikosi, kunyanyaswa kimakusudi, hawakushirikishwa na watu wazima walipokuwa wanapokua. Watoto kama hao huitwa ""katili"" au jeuri. Watoto wengine katili wamefungwa na watu (kwa kawaida wazazi wao wenyewe); katika hali nyingine huu kuachwa kwa watoto kulitokana na wazazi kukataa upungufu mkubwa wa kiakili au mwili kwa mtoto. Huenda watoto wasiotagusana walipitia unyanyasaji mkuu au kiwewe utotoni mwao kabla ya kuachiliwa au kutoroka. Wengine wanadaiwa kulewa na wanyama; wengine wanasemekana kuishi porini kivyao. Anapolelewa kabisa na wanyama wasio wa kibinadamu, mtoto katili huonyesha tabia (ndani ya mipaka ya kimwili) karibu kabisa kama zile za mnyama mahsusi wa utunzaji, kama vile hofu au upurukushani wake kwa wanadamu."

src: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family. Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield. Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.
mt: Uchumi wa kujitunza ni kilimo kinachotengenezwa kwa kutengeneza chakula kufikia kile kinachoweza kufikia kwa kipenzi cha kilimo na familia yake. Kilimo cha kujitunza ni mfano usio na wingi, kwa kawaida usio na dawa, kwa kutumia mali ya kawaida ya mifugo ambayo ni sehemu ya mazingira ya kipenzi kwa kutumia kipindi cha kipenzi au ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala ushawishi wala us
ref: Kilimo cha kujikimu ni kilimo ambacho hufanywa kwa uzalishaji wa chakula cha kutosha tu kukimu mahitaji ya mkulima na familia yake. Kilimo cha kujikimu ni mfumo rahisi, aghalabu wa kikaboni, unaotumia mbegu zilizohifadhiwa na asilia kwa eneo husika, pamoja na mzunguko wa mimea au mbinu mbadala zilizo rahisi ili kuboresha mavuno. Kihistoria, wakulima wengi walijihusisha na kilimo cha kujikimu na hii bado ndiyo hali katika mataifa mengi yanayoendelea.

src: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is what most people associate with traveling: Recreation tourism. This is when people go to a place that is very different from their regular day-to-day life to relax and have fun. Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most common places frequented by recreational tourists. If the objective of one’s visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism. Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country or they may simply opt to focus on just one area.
mt: Japo kuna aina nyingi za utalii, kama ilivyoelezwa, utalii wa kujifungua ni aina inayofanana zaidi na kuendesha kazi. Hii ni wakati ambapo watu wanapokwenda katika eneo ambalo ni tofauti na maisha yao ya kila siku ili kupumzika na kuona nafasi. Bahari, mashabiki ya michezo na mashamba ni kawaida kwa watalii wa kujifungua. Kama lengo la kuwakilisha kwa wakati mmoja kwa wakati mwingine ni kujifungua kwa historia na utamaduni, utalii wa utamaduni ni aina ya utalii. Watalii waweza kufika katika nafasi za kuhesabu za nchi fulani au waweze kujifungua kwa sehemu moja.
ref: Pengine aina ya kawaida zaidi ya utalii ni ambayo watu wengi huhusisha na usafiri: Utalii wa burudani. Huu ni wakati watu wanaenda mahali ambapo ni tofauti sana na maisha yao ya kawaida ya kila siku kupumzika na kufurahia. Pwani, bustani maalum na nyanja za kambi mara nyingi huwa sehemu ambazo hutembelewa sana na watalii wa kujiburudisha. Kama lengo la mwafulani la kutembelea mahali maalum ni kujua historia na utamaduni wake basi aina hii ya utalii inajulikana kama utalii wa kitamaduni. Watalii wanaweza kutembelea alama tofauti za ardhi za nchi maalum au wanaweza tu kuchagua kuangazia eneo moja tu.

src: Individuals who had been involved for several decades helped us appreciate our strengths and passions while candidly assessing difficulties and even failures. While listening to individuals share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insight into the past and some of the personalities who influenced for good or ill the culture of the organization. While understanding one’s history does not assume understanding of culture, it does at least help people gain a sense of where they fall within the history of the organization. While assessing the successes and becoming aware of failures, individuals and the whole of the participating persons discover more deeply the values, mission, and driving forces of the organization. In this instance, recalling previous instances of entrepreneurial behavior and resulting successes helped people to be open to new changes and new direction for the local church. Such success stories lessened the fears of change, while creating positive inclinations toward change in the future.
mt: Watu wanaoendeshwa kwa miaka kadhaa wamekuwa na nafasi ya kujifunza nafasi zetu na wadhifa zetu wakati wa kujadili changamoto na hasa kushindwa. Wakiwa na nafasi ya kujadili kuhusu historia yao, familia yao na historia ya kikundi, tulipata ufahamu wa kina juu ya historia ya kikundi. Kujadili kuhusu ushindi na kujua kuhusu kushindwa, watu na kikundi kimoja kimoja wanaona zaidi kuhusu wadhifa, malengo na nguvu za kikundi. Katika hali hii, kujadili kuhusu historia ya kufanya biashara na ushindi wake uliowezekana kushinda nafasi za kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko na mabadiliko ya kifedha kwa kanisa la kijiji. Kuhusu ushindi huo, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadil
ref: Watu waliohusika kwa miongo kadhaa walitusaidia kuthamini uwezo na shauku zetu huku tukitathmini shida na hata kutofaulu kwa uwazi. Wakati wa kusikiliza watu wakishirikisha hadithi za kibinafsi, kifamilia au kishirika, tulipata ufahamu wa kale wenye thamani na baadhi ya watu ambao waliathiri utamaduni wa shirika kwa njia nzuri au mbaya. Wakati kuelewa historia ya mtu hakumaanishi kuelewa utamaduni, angalau huwasaidia watu kupata hisia za mahali waliko katika historia ya shirika. Wakati wa kutathmini mafanikio na kufahamu kutofaulu, watu binafsi na watu wote wanaoshiriki hugundua kwa kina zaidi maadili, misheni na nguvu za uendeshaji za shirika. Kwa wakati huu, kukumbuka matukio ya awali ya tabia za ujasiriamali na mafanikio yaliyofuatia kulisaidia watu kuwa wazi kwa mabadiliko mapya na mwelekeo mpya wa kanisa la kienyeji. Hadithi kama hizi za mafanikio zilipunguza hofu ya mabadiliko, huku zikiunda mielekeo chanya kuhusu mabadiliko wakati ujao.

Wakiwa na nafasi ya kujadili kuhusu historia yao, familia yao na historia ya kikundi, tulipata ufahamu wa kina juu ya historia ya kikundi. Kujadili kuhusu ushindi na kujua kuhusu kushindwa, watu na kikundi kimoja kimoja wanaona zaidi kuhusu wadhifa, malengo na nguvu za kikundi. Katika hali hii, kujadili kuhusu historia ya kufanya biashara na ushindi wake uliowezekana kushinda nafasi za kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko na mabadiliko ya kifedha kwa kanisa la kijiji. Kuhusu ushindi huo, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko, wakati wa kujadili kuhusu mabadil
ref: Watu waliohusika kwa miongo kadhaa walitusaidia kuthamini uwezo na shauku zetu huku tukitathmini shida na hata kutofaulu kwa uwazi. Wakati wa kusikiliza watu wakishirikisha hadithi za kibinafsi, kifamilia au kishirika, tulipata ufahamu wa kale wenye thamani na baadhi ya watu ambao waliathiri utamaduni wa shirika kwa njia nzuri au mbaya. Wakati kuelewa historia ya mtu hakumaanishi kuelewa utamaduni, angalau huwasaidia watu kupata hisia za mahali waliko katika historia ya shirika. Wakati wa kutathmini mafanikio na kufahamu kutofaulu, watu binafsi na watu wote wanaoshiriki hugundua kwa kina zaidi maadili, misheni na nguvu za uendeshaji za shirika. Kwa wakati huu, kukumbuka matukio ya awali ya tabia za ujasiriamali na mafanikio yaliyofuatia kulisaidia watu kuwa wazi kwa mabadiliko mapya na mwelekeo mpya wa kanisa la kienyeji. Hadithi kama hizi za mafanikio zilipunguza hofu ya mabadiliko, huku zikiunda mielekeo chanya kuhusu mabadiliko wakati ujao.

src: The postmodern approach to learning offers the freedom from absolutes. There is no one good way to learn. In fact, there is not one good thing to learn.Learning takes place in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented. Our current experience with all the do-it-yourself and information presenting, learning-based television shows illustrates this point. So many of us find ourselves watching a television show that informs us of a process or experience in which we will never participate or apply that knowledge. We will never overhaul a car, build a fountain in our backyard, travel to Peru to examine ancient ruins, or remodel our neighbour's house.
mt: Jitihada ya kufundishia kwa mabadiliko ya kisasa ina uhuru kutoka kwa absolu. Hakuna njia moja ya kufundishia bora. Kwa hakika hakuna kitu bora cha kufundishia.Kufundishwa hutokana na mawazo kati ya mwanafunzi na mawazo yanayotolewa. Mawazo yetu kwa sasa kuhusu vyombo vya habari vya kufundishia na kufundishia, vifaa vya kufundishia vya kujitegemea na vifaa vya habari vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundishia vya kufundish
ref: Njia ya usasa ya kujifunza hutoa uhuru kutoka kwa kanuni mahsusi. Hakuna njia moja nzuri ya kujifunza. Kwa kweli, hakuna jambo hata moja zuri la kujifunza. Kujifunza hufanyika katika uzoefu kati ya mwanafunzi na maarifa yanayowasilishwa. Uzoefu wetu wa sasa wa fanya-mwenyewe na uwasilishaji wa taarifa, vipindi vya televisheni vyenye msingi wa kujifunza, vinaonyesha pointi hii. Kwa hivyo wengi wetu hujipata tukitazama kipindi cha runinga ambacho hutujulisha kuhusu mchakato au uzoefu ambao hatutawahi kushiriki au kutumia maarifa hayo. Hatutawahi kukarabati gari lote, kujenga chemchemi katika ua letu la nyuma, kusafiri Peru kukagua magofu ya kale, au kubuni upya nyumba ya jirani.

src: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes). This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you. If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off. Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.
mt: Ukosefu wa kuishi ni mchakato wa kuwakilisha wakati wa kuishi kwa kawia wakati wa kuishi yako na kuishi tena (10-60 dakika). Hii inaweza kufanywa kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia kwa kawia
ref: Ukatizaji wa usingizi ni mchakato wa kuamka kimakusudi wakati wa usingizi wako wa kawaida na kupatwa na usingizi muda mfupi baadaye (dakika 10-60). Hili linaweza kufanywa kwa kutumia saa ya kengele isiyo na kelele kubwa sana ili kukufanya upate fahamu bila kukuamsha kabisa. Kama utajipata ukiweka upya saa ya kengele katika usingizi wako, inaweza kuwekwa upande mwingine wa chumba, ili kukulazimu kuondoka kitandani kuizima. Chaguo zingine za midundobayolojia huhusisha unywaji mwingi (hususan wa maji au chai, dawa maarufu) kabla ya kulala, hali inayomlazimu mtu kuamka ili kwenda haja ndogo.

src: Some people believe that experiencing many artificially induced lucid dreams often enough can be very exhausting. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states. With fewer REMs per night, this state in which you experience actual sleep and your body recovers becomes infrequent enough to become a problem. This is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV. The effect is dependent on how often your brain attempts to lucidly dream per night.

ref: Watu wengine wanaamini kuwa kupata ndoto nyingi bandia mara nyingi kunaweza kuchosha sana. Sababu kuu ya jambo hili ni matokeo ya ndoto dhahiri kupanua kipindi cha wakati kati ya majimbo ya REM. Ikiwa na vipindi vifupi vya usogezaji macho kwa haraka, hali hii ambapo unapata usingizi halisi na mwili wako kupata nafuu huwa nadra kiasi cha kuwa tatizo. src: Virtual teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences. Virtual team members often function as the point of contact for their immediate physical group. They often have more autonomy than conventional team members as their teams may meet according to varying time zones which may not be understood by their local management. The presence of a true “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of a virtual team. The “invisible team” is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member.
mt: Timu za kudumu zinaheshimiwa kwa mafanikio yao kama timu za kawaida, lakini kuna tofauti za kujitahidi. Wanachama wa timu za kudumu mara nyingi wanafanya kazi kama mtekelezaji wa kawaida kwa kikundi chao cha kawaida. Wanachama mara nyingi wanafaa kwa uhuru zaidi kuliko wanachama wa timu za kawaida kwa sababu timu zao zinaweza kushiriki kwa muda tofauti tofauti ambao hawawezi kueleweka na usimamizi wao wa kawaida. Uwezo wa timu “zisizizalishwa” (Larson na LaFasto, 1989, p109) pia ni sehemu ya kawaida ya timu za kudumu. Timu “zisizizalishwa” ni usimamizi wa kawaida kwa kila mtekelezaji. Timu “zisizizalishwa” inatayarisha mafanikio kwa kila mtekelezaji.
ref: Timu za kawaida zinashikiliwa kwa viwango sawa vya ubora kama timu za kawaida lakini kuna tofauti hila. Memba pepe wa timu mara nyingi hutumika kama mahali pa mawasiliano kwa kikundi chao cha kimwili cha wakati huo. Mara nyingi wao huwa na uhuru zaidi kuliko wanachama wa kawaida wa timu kwani timu zao zinaweza kukutana kulingana na maeneo ya wakati yanayotofautiana na inaweza kutoeleweka kwa usimamizi wao. Uwepo wa “timu isiyoonekana” ya kweli (Larson na LaFasto, 1989, uk109) ni kipengele cha kipekee cha timu pepe. “Timu isiyoonekana” ni timu ya usimamizi ambapo kila memba huripoti. Timu isiyoonekana huweka viwango kwa kila memba.

src: Content theories are centered on finding what makes people tick or appeals to them. These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or desires which have been internalized as they mature to adulthood. These theories look at what it is about certain people that make them want the things that they do and what things in their environment will make them do or not do certain things. Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.
mt: Teoria za mawazo zinatokana na kupata nini kinachokwenda kwa watu au kinachovutia. Teoria hizi zinaelekeza kwamba watu wana mahitaji na/mahitaji yasiyotambulika ambayo yameingizwa kama wanaokwenda wakiwa wamejifunza kujituma kwa kujua. Teoria hizi zinavyoangalia nini kinachokwenda kwa watu wengine ambao wana mahitaji yao na nini kinachovutia katika mazingira yao ambayo itaweza kufanya au kosa kufanya nini. Teoria za mawazo zinazozingatia ni Teoria ya Maslow ya Huru la Mahitaji na Teoria ya Hertzberg ya Mifano Mitatu.
ref: Nadharia za maudhui hulenga kupata kinachowafanya watu waendelee au kinachowavutia. Nadharia hizi zinapendekeza kwamba watu wana mahitaji fulani na/au tamaa ambazo zimekita mizizi jinsi wanavyokomaa katika utu uzima. Nadharia hizi huangalia ni nini kinachowahusu watu fulani ambacho huwafanya watake vitu wanavyofanya na ni mambo gani katika mazingira yao yanayowafanya kufanya au kutofanya mambo fulani. Nadharia mbili maarufu za maudhui ni Udadisi wa Maslow wa Mahitaji na Nadharia ya Vipengele Viwili ya Hertzberg.

src: The much-abused and often-ridiculed rule of thirds is a simple guideline creating dynamism while keeping a measure of order in an image. It states that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of lines dividing the image into thirds vertically and horizontally (see example).

src: For example, the most common still image photography format in the world is 35mm, which was the dominant film size at the close of the analog film era. It is still produced today, but more importantly its aspect ratio has been inherited by digital camera image sensor formats. The 35mm format is actually, somewhat confusingly, 36mm in width by 24mm in height. The aspect ratio of this format (dividing by twelve to obtain the simplest whole-number ratio) is therefore said to be 3:2. Many common formats (APS family of formats, for example) are equal to or closely approximate this aspect ratio.
mt: Kwa mfano, formati ya picha ya kawaida zaidi katika dunia ni 35mm, ambayo ilikuwa formati ya kawaida kwa filamu katika mwisho wa muda wa filamu. Inaendelea kutengenezwa leo, lakini zaidi, asili yake ya formati ya kawaida ya kamera za digitali za kichwa cha picha. Formati ya 35mm ni 36mm kwa ukubwa na 24mm kwa ukomo. Namba ya asili ya formati hii (kutumia namba 12 kwa kupata namba za kawaida) ni 3:2. Formati za kawaida nyingi (familia ya formati za APS, kwa mfano) zinaendelea kufuata namba hii.
ref: Kwa mfano, umbizo la upigaji picha tuli wa kawaida zaidi duniani ni milimita 35, ambayo ndiyo iliyokuwa saizi kuu ya filamu katika zama za sinema za kikale. Bado inatolewa hadi wa leo, lakini kwa umuhimu zaidi uwiano wa kipengele chake umerithiwa na umbizo za kihisio cha picha za kamera za kidijitali. Muundo wa 35mm kwa kweli, kwa kiasi Fulani unachanganya, 36mm kwa upana na 24mm kwa urefu. Uwiano-vipimo wa muundo huu (kugawa na kumi na mbili ili kupata uwiano rahisi zaidi wa namba kamili) basi husemekana kuwa 3:2. Miundo mingi ya kawaida (familia ya APS ya miundoi, kwa mfano) ni sawa na au takribani sawa na uwiano huu.

src: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the focal complexity and number of lens elements required to achieve a range of focal lengths is much greater than for prime lenses. This is becoming less of an issue as lens manufacturers achieve higher standards in lens production. This has allowed zoom lenses to produce pictures of a quality comparable to that achieved by lenses with fixed focal length. Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (the speed) of the lens is usually lower. This makes inexpensive zoom lenses hard to use in low-light conditions without a flash.

Hili linaendelea kuwa suala lisilo la muhimu jinsi watengenezaji wa lenzi wanavyofikia viwango vya juu katika uzalizaji wa lenzi. Hii imewezesha lenzi za kukuza kutoa picha zenye ubora unaoweza kulinganishwa na ule unaofikiwa na lenzi zenye urefu msingi usiobadilika. Ubaya mwingine wa lenzi za ukuzaji ni kuwa kilango kipana zaidi (kasi) cha lenzi kwa kawaida huwa cha chini. Hii hufanya lenzi za kukuza za bei ya chini vigumu kutumia katika hali ya mwangaza duni bila mwako.

src: Mysticism is the pursuit of communion with, identity with, or conscious awareness of an ultimate reality, divinity, spiritual truth, or God. The believer seeks a direct experience, intuition, or insight into divine reality/the deity or dieties. Followers pursue certain ways of living, or practices that are intended to nurture those experiences. Mysticism can be distinguished from other forms of religious belief and worship by its emphasis on the direct personal experience of a unique state of consciousness, particularly those of a peaceful, insightful, blissful, or even ecstatic character.

ref: Utatanishi ni kuau tekeleza ushirika na, utambulisho na, ufahamu wa ukweli wa mwisho, uungu, ukweli au Mungu. Mwamini hutafuta uzoefu wa moja kwa moja, uelewa au maarifa ya ukweli/mungu au miungu Wafuasi hutafuta njia fulani za kuishi, au mazoea ambayo yanakusudiwa kulea uzoefu huo. src: For a long time during the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, it was believed the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori people, who hunted giant birds called moas. The theory then established the idea that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in a Great Fleet and took New Zealand from the Moriori, establishing an agricultural society. However, new evidence suggests that the Moriori were a group of mainland Maori who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing their own distinctive, peaceful culture. There was also another tribe on the Chatham islands these were Maori who migrated away from New Zealand. They called themselves the Moriori there were a few skirmishes and in the end, the Moriori were wiped out
mt: Kwa muda mrefu katika karne ya 19 na 20, ilikubaliwa kwamba wakazi wa kwanza wa New Zealand walikuwa watu wa Maori, waliokuwa wakifuga ndege kama moa. Teoria iliyotangazwa ilielezea kwamba watu wa Maori walikuwa wakimiji kutoka Polynesia katika Jumba Kuu na kuwaua Moriori, kufanya jamii ya kilimo. Lakini, taarifa mpya inasema kwamba Moriori walikuwa kundi la Maori ya kanda ya kati, waliokuwa wakimiji kutoka New Zealand kwa Chatham Islands, kufanya utamaduni wake mwenyewe, amani. Kuna kundi lingine katika Chatham islands hii walikuwa Maori waliokuwa wakimiji kutoka New Zealand. Waliitwa Moriori. Kuna mashambulizi chache na mwisho, Moriori waliwachia.
ref: Kwa muda mrefu wakati wa karne za kumi na tisa na ishirini, iliaminika wakazi wa kwanza wa Nyuzilandi walikuwa watu wa Maori, waliowinda ndege wakubwa walioitwa moa. Basi nadharia ikaanzisha wazo kwamba watu wa Maori walihama kutoka Polynesia katika Kundi Kubwa na kuchukua Nyuzilandi kutoka kwa Moriori, na kuanzisha jamii ya kilimo. Hata hivyo, ushahidi mpya unadokeza kwamba Moriori walikuwa kundi la Maori wa bara waliohama kutoka Nyuzilandi hadi Visiwa vya Chatham, na wakakuza utamaduni wao wenyewe wa kipekee na wenye amani. Kulikuwa pia na makabila mengine kwenye visiwa vya Chatham, ambao walikuwa Maori waliohamia Nyuzilandi. Walijiita Moriori kulikuwa na mapigano machache na mwishowe, Moriori wakauawa wote

src: Pureland origami is origami with the restriction that only one fold may be done at a time, more complex folds like reverse folds are not allowed, and all folds have straightforward locations. It was developed by John Smith in the 1970s to help inexperienced folders or those with limited motor skills.

src: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilisation in the northwest Indian subcontinent encompassing most of modern-day Pakistan and some regions in northwest India and northeast Afghanistan. The civilisation flourished in the basins of the Indus River wherefore it derives its name. Although some scholars speculate that since the civilisation also existed in the basins of the now dried up Sarasvati River, it should be aptly called the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, while some call it the Harappan Civilization after Harappa, the first of its sites to be excavated in the 1920s.
mt: Ufalme wa Mto Hinda ulikuwa falme la karne ya chuma katika eneo la kaskazini mwa India ya leo, ambalo linafanana na nchi zote za Pakistan na sehemu za kaskazini mwa India na mashariki mwa Afghanistan. Falme hilo lilivyofaulu katika mabonde ya mto Hinda kwa sababu hivyo jina lake linatokana na mto huo. Wataalamu wachache wanavyocheza kwamba kwa sababu falme hilo pia lilikuwepo katika mabonde ya mto Sarsvati, ambao sasa hivi umekuwa na maji, kwa hiyo jina lake linapaswa kuwa Ufalme wa Hinda-Sarsvati, wengine wanavyocheza kwamba jina lake linapaswa kuwa Ufalme wa Harappan baada ya Harappa, kwa sababu Harappa ilikuwa kwanza kati ya makao yake yaliyotengenezwa katika miaka ya 1920.
ref: Ustaarabu wa Indus Valley ulikuwa wa Enzi za Shaba kaskazini magharibi mwa bara ndogo la Hindi, ukijumuisha kwa wingi Pakistani ya sasa na sehemu za kaskazini magharibi mwa Hindu na kaskazini magharibi mwa Afganistani. Ustaarabu ulinawiri katika bonde la Mto Indus ambapo ulitoa jina lake. Ingawa baadhi ya wasomi hukisia kwamba kwa sababu ustaarabu pia ulikuwapo katika mabonde ya Mto Sarasvati uliokauka sasa, unafaa kuitwa Ustaarabu wa Indus-Sarasvati, huku wengine wakiuita Ustaarabu wa Harappa, kutokana na Harappa, eneo lake la kwanza kuchimbwa katika miaka ya 1920.

src: The war expenditures of U.S. imperialism in the conquest of the Philippines were paid for by the Filipino people themselves. They were compelled to pay taxes to the U.S. colonial regime to defray a major part of the expenditures and the interest on bonds floated in the name of the Philippine government through the Wall Street banking houses. Of course, the superprofits derived from the protracted exploitation of the Filipino people would constitute the basic gains of U.S. imperialism.
mt: Ushahidi wa vita wa utawala wa kimperialisti wa Marekani katika kushinda Ufilipino ulitumia fedha za watu wa Ufilipino wenyewe. ref: Matumizi ya kivita kwa ubeberu wa Marekani katika ushindi dhidi ya Ufilipino yaligharimiwa na watu wa Ufilipino wenyewe. Walilazimishwa kulipa kodi kwa serikali ya wakoloni ya Amerika ili kugharamia sehemu kubwa ya matumizi na riba juu ya dhamana zilizowekwa kwa jina la serikali ya Ufilipino kupitia nyumba za benki za Wall Street. Bila shaka, faida kubwa kutokana na dhuluma za muda mrefu za watu wa Ufilipino ziliunda mapato ya msingi ya ubeberu wa Marekani.

src: To understand the Templars one must understand the context that prompted the creation of the order. The age where the events took place is commonly referred as the High Middle Ages the period of European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000–1300). The High Middle Ages were preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which by convention ends around 1500.
mt: Kuelewa watakatifu wanaoitwa Templari lazima uweze kuelewa mazingira yaliyosababisha kuanzishwa kwa jumuia hiyo. Mwaka ambako yaliyotokea ni kawaida kujulikana kama Ufalme wa Juu wa Ulaya, kipindi cha historia ya Ulaya katika miaka ya 11, 12, na 13 (AD 1000–1300). Ufalme wa Juu wa Ulaya ulifuatwa na Ufalme wa Kwanza na Ufalme wa Kati, ambayo kwa kawaida inakaribishwa kwa mwaka 1500.
ref: Ili kuelewa templar ni lazima mtu aelewe muktadha ambao ulisababisha uundaji wa agizo. Kipindi ambacho matukio yalitokea kwa kawaida hujulikana kama Enzi za Juu za kati, kipindi katika historia ya Ulaya katika Karne za 11, 12, na 13 (1000-1300 Baada ya Kristo). Enzi za Juu za Kati zilitanguliwa na Enzi za Mapema za Kati na kufuatiwa na Enzi za Mwisho za Kati, ambazo kwa mapatano zinaishia karibu 1500.

src: The militaristic nature of the Roman empire aided in the development of medical advances. Doctors began to be recruited by Emperor Augustus and even formed the first Roman Medical Corps for use in the aftermath of battles. Surgeons had knowledge of various sedatives including morphine from extracts of poppy seeds and scopolamine from herbane seeds. They became proficient at amputation to save patients from gangrene as well as tourniquets and arterial clamps to stem blood flow. Over multiple centuries, the Roman empire led to great gains in the field of medicine and formed much of the knowledge we know today.
mt: Tabia ya kijeshi ya Dola la Roma ilisaidia katika maendeleo ya mawazo ya dharura. Wadaktari walianza kutambuliwa na Kaisari Augustus na wakawa wakubwa wa kwanza wa Korpusi wa Daktari wa Roma kwa kutumia baada ya vita. Wadaktari walikuwa na uzoefu wa kujua sedati kama vile morphine kutoka kwa mifugo ya mafuta ya popi na scopolamine kutoka kwa mifugo ya herbane. Walikuwa wakubwa katika kupanda kifua kwa ajili ya wagonjwa kutokana na gangrena pamoja na tourniquets na clamps za mdomo kwa ajili ya kupungua mawimbi. Katika miaka mingi, Dola la Roma lilisaidia katika maendeleo ya mawazo ya dharura na kujenga mawazo yasiyotofautiana.
ref: Tabia za kijeshi za Milki ya Kirumi zilisaidia sana kwa maendeleo ya matibabu. Madaktari walianza kuajiriwa na Mtawala Augustus na hata kuunda kitengo kikubwa cha kwanza cha Matibabu cha Kirumi kwa ajili ya kutumika baada ya vita. Madaktari wa upasuaji walikuwa na uelewa wa vitulizo kadhaa zikiwamo mofini kutoka kwa mbegu za mpopi na scopolamina kutoka kwa mbegu za henbeni. Walipata kuwa na ustadi wa kukata viungo vya mwili ili kuokoa wagonjwa kutokana na gangrini na vile vile mafundo na vibanio vya mishipa ili kutuliza mtiririko wa damu. Katika karne nyingi, milki ya Kirumi ilipelekea faida kubwa katika uga wa tiba na ikaunda mengi ya maarifa tunayoyajua leo.

src: Vision, or the ability to see depends on visual system sensory organs or eyes. There are many different constructions of eyes, ranging in complexity depending on the requirements of the organism. The different constructions have different capabilities, are sensitive to different wave-lengths and have differing degrees of acuity, also they require different processing to make sense of the input and different numbers to work optimally.

src: "Sikhism is a religion from the Indian sub-continent. It originated in the Punjab region during the 15th century from a sectarian split within the Hindu tradition. Sikhs consider their faith to be a separate religion from Hinduism though they acknowledge its Hindu roots and traditions. Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which is Punjabi for ""way of the guru"". The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions but in Sikhism has taken on an importance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs. The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469–1539). There followed in succession a further nine gurus."
mt: "Sikhism ni dini kutoka katika eneo la India. Ilianzia katika eneo la Punjab katika karne ya 15 kutokana na mabadiliko ya kikabila katika dini ya Hindu. src: "Sikhism is a religion from the Indian sub-continent. It originated in the Punjab region during the 15th century from a sectarian split within the Hindu tradition. Sikhs consider their faith to be a separate religion from Hinduism though they acknowledge its Hindu roots and traditions. Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which is Punjabi for ""way of the guru"". The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions but in Sikhism has taken on an importance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs. The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469–1539). There followed in succession a further nine gurus."

src: "Attention Deficit Disorder ""is a neurological syndrome whose classic defining triad of symptoms including impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excess energy"". It is not a learning disability, it is a learning disorder; it ""affects 3 to 5 percent of all children, perhaps as many as 2 million American children"". Children with ADD have a hard time focusing on things like school work, but they can concentrate on things they enjoy doing like playing games or watching their favorite cartoons or writing sentences without punctuation. These children tend to get into a lot of trouble, because they ""engage in risky behaviors, get into fights, and challenge authority"" in order to stimulate their brain, since their brain can not be stimulated by normal methods. ADD affects relationships with other peers because other children can not understand why they act the way that they do or why they spell they way they do or that their maturity level is different."

ref: "Tatizo la Upungufu wa Umakini ""ni ugonjwa wa neva ambao dalili zake tatu za kawaida za kuufafanua ni msukumo, mvurugo na utendaji wa kupita kiasi au nguvu za ziada."" Si ulemavu wa kusoma, ni mvurugiko wa kusoma; “unaathiri asilimia 3 hadi 5 ya watoto wote, pengine takriban watoto milioni 2 wa Marekani”. Watoto walio na ADD huwa na wakati mgumu kuangazia mambo kama kazi za shuleni, lakini wanaweza kukazia fikira mambo wanayopenda kuyafanya kama kucheza michezo au kutazama katuni zao vibwedo au kuandika sentensi bila kuakifisha. Watoto hawa huingia kwenye shida nyingi kwa sababu “wanajihusisha na tabia hatari, wanaingia kwenye vita na kuipa changamoto mamlaka” ili kuchechemua akili zao kwa sababu akili zao haziwezi kuchechemuliwa kwa njia za kawaida. Ugonjwa wa Upungufu wa Usikivu huathiri uhusiano wao na wenzi wengine kwa sababu watoto wengine hawawezi kuelewa kwa nini wao hujifanya kwa njia hiyo au kwa nini wao huduwaa jinsi wanavyofanya au kwamba kiwango cha kukomaa kwao ni tofauti."

src: While project based learning should make learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding goes a step beyond. Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project. Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, in other words, a teacher is a form of scaffold but so is the little paperclip man in Microsoft Office. Virtual Scaffolds are internalized in the software and are meant to question, prompt, and explain procedures that may have been to challenging for the student to handle alone.

ref: Wakati elimu ya msingi wa mradi kunapaswa kufanya elimu kuwa rahisi na ya kupendeza zaidi, udungu huenda hatua zaidi. Mbinu za mafunzo si njia ya kusoma lakini huduma ambayo hutoa usaidizi kwa watu ambao wanapitia hali mpya ya masomo kama vile kutumia programu mpya ya kompyuta au kuanza mradi mpya. Majukwaa yanaweza kuwa dhahiri na pia halisi, kwa maneno mengine, mwalimu ni aina ya jukwaa lakini pia ndivyo kilivyo kile kijitu cha karatasi katika Microsoft Office. Majukwaa Pepe yamewekwa ndani ya programu kwa kusudi la kuhoji, kushawishi, na kuelezea taratibu ambazo huenda zilikuwa changamoto kubwa kwa mwanafunzi kushughulikia peke yake.

src: MySpace is the third most popular website used in the United States and has 54 million profiles currently. These websites have gotten a lot of attention, especially in the education setting. There are positive aspects to these websites, which include, being able to easily setup a class page which can include blogs, videos, photos, and other features. This page can easily be accessed by providing just one web address, which makes it easy to remember and easy to type in for students who may have trouble using the keyboard or with spelling. It can be customized to make it easy to read and also with as much or little color as desired.
mt: MySpace ni tano kuu zaidi ya tovuti zinazotumika katika nchi za Marekani na kuna 54 milioni ya maandishi sasa. Tovuti hizi zimepata kipaumbele, hasa katika mazingira ya elimu. Kuna nafasi za kushinda katika tovuti hizi, ambazo zinajumuisha, kujenga pana la kila kipaji, ambacho kinaweza kubadilishwa, picha, na nyingine za kifani. ref: MySpace ni tovuti ya tatu kwa umaarufu inayotumika nchini Marekani na ina wasajili milioni 54 sasa hivi. Tovuti hizi zimepata umakinifu mwingi sana, hasa katika mpangilio wa kielimu. Kuna vipengele chanya kuhusu tovuti hizi, ambazo ni pamoja na, kuwa rahisi kusanidi ukurasa wa darasa ambao unaweza kutia ndani blogu, video, picha, na vipengele vingine. Ukurasa huu unaweza kufikiwa kwa urahisi kwa kutoa anwani moja tu ya wavuti, ambayo inaifanya kuwa rahisi kukumbuka na rahisi kuchapa kwa wanafunzi ambao wanaweza kuwa na shida kutumia kibodi au na tahajia. Inaweza kugeuzwa ili iwe rahisi kusoma na pia na rangi nyingi au kidogo kama inavyonuiwa.

src: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were put to the test when riots in Poland, where workers were protesting against food shortages and wage cuts, turned into a general protest against Communism. Although in the end, Krushchev sent in tanks to restore order, he did give way to some economic demands and agreed to appoint the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.
mt: Lakini Juni 1956, taarifa za Krushchev zilitolewa kwenye kesi wakati wa mapinduzi Poland, ambapo wafanyaji kazi walipigania dhidi ya kupotea kwa chakula na kupunguza kipaumbele, kufika kwenye mapinduzi kwa kudai kwa kila kitu. Hata hivyo, katika mwisho, Krushchev alitupa kwa taarifa za kiuchumi na kubadilisha Wladyslaw Gomulka kama mwenyeji mpya wa waziri.
ref: Hata hivyo, mnamo Juni 1956, ahadi za Kruschev ziliwekwa katika jaribio wakati maandamano katika Polandi, ambapo wafanyakazi walikuwa wakipinga upungufu wa chakula na kukatwa kwa mishahara, yaligeuka kuwa maandamano ya jumla dhidi ya Ukomunisti. Ingawa hatimaye, Kruschev alituma vifaru kurejesha utulivu, aliridhia baadhi ya mahitaji ya kiuchumi na akakubali kumteua mtu maarufu Wladyslaw Gomulka kama waziri mkuu mpya.

src: Germany was a common enemy in World War 2, leading to cooperation between the USSR and USA. With the end of the war the clashes of system, process and culture led to the countries falling out. With two years of the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies and the Cold War began. It was to last for the next 40 years and would be fought for real, by proxy armies, on battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.
mt: Ujerumani ilikuwa kiongozi kwa kushindana katika Vita Kuu ya Pili, kwa hiyo kufanya kazi pamoja kati ya Umoja wa Ulaya na Marekani. Baada ya kushinda vita, mashambulizi ya mfumo, mienendo na utamaduni yalileta nchi zilizokuwa wenzao wakati wa vita kuwa wapinzani. Na vita ya baridi ilianza. Iliendelea kwa miaka 40 na kushambuliwa kwa asili, kwa jeshi za wapinzani, katika mashambulizi kutoka Afrika hadi Asia, Afghanistan, Cuba na nchi nyingine nyingi.
ref: Ujerumani ilikuwa adui wa kawaida katika Vita vya Pili vya Dunia, hivyo kupelekea ushirikiano wa USSR na Marekani. Kwa kumalizika kwa vita mgongano wa mfumo, mchakato na utamaduni vilipelekea kutengana kwa nchi. Na miaka mbili ya kumalizika kwa vita, washirika wa zamani waligeuka kuwa maadui na Vita Baridi vikaanza. Ilikuwa idumu kwa miaka 40 ijayo na ingepigwa kwa kweli na vikosi vya kiwakala, katika nyanja za vita toka Afrika hadi Asia, katika Afghanistani, Kuba na sehemu nyingine nyingi

src: The Nervous System maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses through out the body to keep the flow of blood going as well as undisturbed. These nerve impulses can be sent so quickly throughout the body which helps keep the body safe from any potential threat.

src: "The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only one of the seven wonders that is still standing today. Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor dead Pharaoh. The Giza Plateau, or ""Giza Necropolis"" in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead contains several pyramids (of which the great pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the great Sphinx. The great pyramid was created to honor the Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members."
mt: "Mpira mkubwa wa Giza ni mmoja tu ya wapumbavu saba ambao hushika leo. Mpira huu ulitengenezwa na Wamisri katika karne ya tatu BK, Mpira mkubwa ni mmoja kati ya mpira mingi makubwa yaliyotengenezwa kwa ajili ya kuheshimu Pharaoh waliouawa. Mpira mkuu wa Giza ulitengenezwa kwa ajili ya Pharaoh Khufu, na mpira mingi, makaburi, na tembea zilizotengenezwa kwa ajili ya mabibi na wazazi wa Khufu.
ref: "Piramidi kuu katika Giza ndiyo ya pekee ya maajabu saba ambayo bado inasimama leo. Piramidi Kuu iliyojengwa na Wamisri katika karne ya tatu BCE ni mojawapo ya majengo makubwa yaliyojengwa kwa heshima ya Firauni waliofariki. Kilima cha Giza, au ""Giza Necropolis"" katika Bonde la Wafu la Misri kina piramidi kadhaa (ambazo piramidi kuu ni kubwa zaidi), makaburi kadhaa madogo, hekalu kadhaa, na Sphinx kuu. Piramidi kuu iliundwa ili kumheshimu Firauni Khufu, na piramidi, makaburi na mahekalu mengine mengi madogo yalijengwa ili kuheshimu wake na wanafamilia wa Khufu."

src: The temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed on July 21, 356 BCE in an act of arson committed by Herostratus. According to the story, his motivation was fame at any cost. The Ephesians, outraged, announced that Herostratus' name never be recorded. The Greek historian Strabo later noted the name, which is how we know today. The temple was destroyed on the same night that Alexander the Great was born. Alexander, as king, offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was denied. Later, after Alexander died, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BCE.
mt: Tempi la Artemis katika Ephesus ilivyopinduliwa tarehe 21 Julai 356 BK kwa kufanywa kwa kasi kwa jahazi kutoka nchi ya Ulaya. Kulinganifu, kazi hiyo ilikuwa kwa ajili ya kuwa na jina. Wanasayansi wa Ephesus, wakiongoza, walitangaza kwamba jina la Herostratus haliwezi kutajwa. Historia ya Ulaya Strabo baadaye alitaja jina, ambalo ni kwa sababu sisi tunajua leo. Tempi ilipinduliwa katika usiku ambapo Alexander the Great alizaliwa. Alexander, kama mfalme, alikuwa tayari kutoa fedha kwa ajili ya kujenga tempi tena, lakini alipigwa kibali. Baadaye, baada ya Alexander kufa, tempi ilijengwa tena tarehe 323 BK.
ref: Hekalu ya Artemis kule Ephesus iliharibiwa julai 21, 356 BCE kwa kisa cha moto kilichotekelezwa na Herostratus. Kulingana na hadithi, motisha wake ulikuwa umaarufu kwa gharama yoyote. Waefeso, kwa kukasirika, walitangaza kuwa jina la Herostratus lisirekodiwe daima. Mwanahistoria wa Kigiriki Strabo alibaini hilo jina, ambalo ndilo tunavyolijua leo. Hekalu liliharibiwa usiku ule ule Alexander Mkuu alizaliwa. Alexander, kama mfalme, alijitolea kugharimia ujenzi upya wa hekalu, lakini toleo lake lilikataliwa. Baadaye, baada ya Alexander kufa, hekalu lilijengwa upya mnamo 323 BCE.

src: The first known transportation was walking, humans began walking upright two million years ago with the emergence of Homo Erectus (meaning upright man). Their predecessors, the Australopithecus did not walk upright as habitually. Bipedal specializations are found in Australopithecus fossils from 4.2-3.9 million years ago, although Sahelanthropus may have walked on two legs as early as seven million years ago.
mt: Uvumbuzi wa kwanza wa usafirishaji ulikuwa kwa kutembea, binadamu walianza kutembea kama wanaume wawili miaka milioni miwili iliyopita wakati wa kutokea kwa Homo Erectus (kutoka kwa kujitambua kama mwanadamu mwenye miguu mibovu). Wao waliotangulia, Australopithecus hawakutembea kama wanaume wawili kama kawaida. Mabadiliko ya kawaida ya kutembea yanasababishwa na mabaki ya Australopithecus kutoka miaka milioni 4.2-3.9, wakati Sahelanthropus alikuwa kutembea kama wanaume wawili tangu miaka milioni 7.
ref: Namna yak kwanza ya uchukuzi iliyofahamika ni kutembea, binadaum walianza kutembea wima miaka milioni mbili iliyopita, baada ya kuibuka kwa wanadamu wima. Watangulizi wao, Australopithecus hawakutembea wima kama kawaida. Utaalamu wa bipedali unapatikana katika visukuku vya Australopithekasi kuanzia miaka milion 4.2 hadi 3.9 iliyopita, ingawa inawezekana kuwa Sahelanthropasi walitembea kwa miguu miwili takriban miaka milioni saba iliyopita.

src: Using ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans. The job of navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with your enemy's ability to move his people and goods. One of the most noteworthy recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of WWII. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain. At the same time, the German navy, using mainly U-boats, was trying to stop this traffic. Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe.
mt: Kuweka vitu kwa meli ni njia bora zaidi ya kuchukua watu wengi na vitu vingi kwa barabara za bahari. Kazi ya vyombo vya usalama ni kuhakikisha nchi yako inaweza kuchukua watu wako na vitu vyako, wakati wakati mwingine, kuhatarisha nchi yako inaweza kuchukua watu na vitu vya kifalme. Mifano mirefu ya kihistoria ya hivyo ni kipindi cha kwanza cha kuhusika kwa Ujerumani katika Vita vya Dunia ya Pili. Wamarekani walikuwa wakifanya kazi ya kuchukua watu na vitu vya kifalme kutoka Uingereza kwa bahari ya Atlantiki. Wakati mwingine, meli za kifalme za Ujerumani, kwa kawaida meli za kifalme za kujipanga, zilikuwa zinakataza huo kipindi. Kama wakati mwingine wamarekani hawakufaulu, Ujerumani kwa kawaida inaweza kuchukua Uingereza kama ilivyokuwa kwa nchi nyingine za Ulaya.
ref: Kutumia meli kusafirisha bidhaa kwa kiasi kikubwa ilikuwa njia bora zaidi ya kusafirisha halaiki ya watu na bidhaa nyingi baharini. Kazi ya Jeshi la wanamaji kwa kiasili imekuwa ni kuhakikisha kuwa nchi yako ina uwezo wa kusafirisha watu na bidhaa zako, wakati huo huo, kuzuia uwezo wa adui wako wa kuhamisha watu wake na bidhaa. Mojawapo ya mifano maarufu ya hivi karibuni ni kampeni ya Kaskazini mwa Atlantiki ya Vita Vikuu vya Pili vya Dunia. Wamarekani walikuwa wakijaribu kusafirisha watu na vifaa kupitia Bahari ya Atlantiki ili kuwasaidia Waingereza. Wakati huo huo, askari wa majeshi ya Ujerumani, kwa kutumia nyambizi, yalikuwa yakijaribu kuzuia trafiki hii. Ikiwa Muungano ungeshindwa, pengine Ujerumani ingeweza kushinda Uingereza kama vile ilivyokuwa imeshinda Uropa.

src: The invention of spoke wheels made Assyrian chariots lighter, faster, and better prepared to outrun soldiers and other chariots. Arrows from their deadly crossbows could penetrate the armor of rival soldiers. About 1000 B.C., the Assyrians introduced the first cavalry. A cavalry is an army that fights on horseback. The saddle had not yet been invented, so the Assyrian cavalry fought on the bare backs of their horses.
mt: Ujenzi wa kisasi cha ganda la mabanda lilimfanya gari za Assyria kuwa na uwezo wa kushinda, kujivua na kujivua wakati wa kushinda na gari za wenzao. Mabanda yao ya kisasi ya kawaida yalitupatia uwezo wa kupenya nguo za wenzao. src: The Babylonians built each of their gods a primary temple that was considered the home of the god. People would bring sacrifices to the gods and the priests would try to attend to the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals. Each temple had an open temple courtyard and then an inner sanctuary that only the priests could enter. Sometimes special pyramid shaped towers, called ziggurats, were built to be a part of the temples. The top of the tower was special sanctuary for the god.
mt: Wababuloni waliweka kila mungu mkiu mkuu ambao ulikuwa nyumba ya mungu. Watu wakibali kwa mungu na watawaasisi wakipendeza mahitaji ya mungu kwa majaji na kwa mifumo na michezo. Kila mkuu ulikuwa na barabara ya kawaida ya kifodini na ndani ya mkiu mkuu ambao watawaasisi pekee walikuwa na nafasi. src: The Babylonians built each of their gods a primary temple that was considered the home of the god. People would bring sacrifices to the gods and the priests would try to attend to the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals. Each temple had an open temple courtyard and then an inner sanctuary that only the priests could enter. Sometimes special pyramid shaped towers, called ziggurats, were built to be a part of the temples. The top of the tower was special sanctuary for the god.
mt: Wababuloni waliweka kila mungu mkiu mkuu ambao ulikuwa nyumba ya mungu. Watu wakibali kwa mungu na watawaasisi wakipendeza mahitaji ya mungu kwa majaji na kwa mifumo na michezo. Kila mkuu ulikuwa na barabara ya kawaida ya kifodini na ndani ya mkiu mkuu ambao watawaasisi pekee walikuwa na nafasi. src: "Yes! King Tutankhamun, sometimes referred to as ""King Tut"" or ""The Boy King"", is one of the most well known ancient Egyptian kings in modern times. Interestingly, he was not considered to be very important in ancient times and was not recorded on most ancient king lists. However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity. While many tombs of the past were robbed, this tomb was left virtually undisturbed. Most of the items buried with Tutankhamun have been well preserved, including thousands of artefacts made from precious metals and rare stones."
mt: "Ndiyo! Mfalme Tutankhamun, mara nyingi anajulikana kama ""Mfalme Tut"" au ""Mfalme wa Kijana"", ni mmoja wa wafalme wa Misri ya Kale waliyofahamika zaidi katika miaka ya sasa. Kwa mujibu wa mafundisho, alikuwa hakika si kawaida katika miaka ya Kale, na hakika hakuwa katika orodha ya wafalme wengi. Lakini ujuzi wa kaburi lake katika mwaka 1922 kufanya kama mmoja wa wafalme waliyofahamika zaidi. Kwa mujibu wa mafundisho, wakati wengi wa kaburi zilizotengenezwa zilikuwa zimechafuka, kaburi lake lilikuwa limeshikwa kwa kiasi kikubwa. Zaidi ya zaidi, zaidi ya vitu vilivyotengenezwa na dhahabu na mabati yalivyopewa na Mfalme Tutankhamun yalivyopewa na Mfalme Tutankhamun yalivyopewa na Mfalme Tutankhamun yalivyopewa na Mfalme Tutankhamun yalivyopewa na Mfalme Tutankhamun yalivyopewa na Mfalme Tutankhamun yalivyopewa na Mfalme Tutankhamun yalivyopewa na Mfalme Tutankhamun yalivyopewa na Mfalme Tutankhamun yalivyopewa na Mfalme Tutankhamun yalivyopewa na Mfalme Tutankhamun yalivyopewa na Mfalme Tutankhamun yalivyopewa na Mfalme Tutankhamun yalivyopewa na Mfalme Tutankhamun yalivyopewa na Mfalme Tutankhamun yalivyopewa na Mfalme Tutankhamun yalivyopewa na Mfalme Tutankhamun yalivyopewa na Mfalme Tutankhamun yalivyopewa na Mfalme Tutankhamun
ref: Ndiyo! Mfalme Tutankhamuni, ambaye wakati mwingine hutambuliwa kama “Mfalme Tuti” au “Mfalme Mvulana”, ni mmojawapo wa wafalme wa zamani wa Misri wanaojulikana sana katika nyakati za sasa. Kwa kushangaza, hakuchukuliwa kuwa muhimu katika zamani za kale na hakurekodiwa kwenye nyingi za orodha za wafalme. Hata hivyo, ugunduzi wa kaburi lake mnamo 1922 ulimfanya mtu mashuhuri. Huku makaburi mengi ya zamani yakiporwa, kaburi hili liliachwa karibu bila kusumbuliwa kamwe. Vitu vingi vilivyozikwa na Tutankhamun vimehifadhiwa vizuri, ikiwa ni pamoja na maelfu ya sanaa zilizoundwa kutoka kwa madini ya thamani na mawe adimu.

src: We know many Greek politicians, scientists, and artists. Possibly the most known person of this culture is Homer, the legendary blind poet, who composed two masterpieces of Greek literature: the poems Iliad and Odyssey. Sophocles and Aristophanes are still popular playwrights and their plays are considered to be among the greatest works of world literature. Another famous Greek is a mathematician Pythagoras, mostly known for his famous theorem about relations of the sides of right triangles.
mt: Hatuna wengi wanaokana na wabunge, wanasayansi na wataalamu wa Ulaya. Mwanamke mmoja wa kike wa kisiasa, sayansi na sanaa ni Homer, mwanamke mwenye uwezo wa kuandika, ambaye alitunga michezo ya Iliad na Odyssey. Sophocles na Aristophanes wanaendeshwa kwa mara nyingi na michezo yao yanavyoendeshwa kama kati ya michezo bora zaidi ya sanaa za ulimwengu. Mwanasayansi mwingine wa Ulaya ni Pythagoras, anayejulikana kwa mifano yake kuhusu mifano ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya mabonde ya
ref: Tunawajua wengi wa wanasiasa, wanasayansi na wasanii wa Ugiriki. Yamkini mtu anayejulikana sana katika utamaduni huu ni Homer, malenga wa mashairi aliyekuwa kipofu, aliyebuni tungo mbili bora sana za fasihi ya Kigiriki: mashairi Iliad na Odyssey. Sophocles na Aristophanes bado ni waandishi maarufu wa michezo ya kuigiza na michezo yao huzingatiwa kuwa miongoni mwa kazi kubwa za fasihi ya ulimwengu. Mgiriki mwingine maarufu ni Pythagoras, anayejulikana sana kwa nadharia zake maarufu za hisabati kuhusu uhusiano wa pande za pembe tatu zenye pembemraba.

src: In the warm climate of the Middle East, the house was not so important. Most of the life of the Hebrew family happened in the open air. Women did the cooking in the yard; stores were just open counters looking into the street. Stone was used for building houses. There were no large forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was extremely expensive.
mt: Katika hali ya hewa ya Mashariki ya Kati, nyumba haikupendwa sana. Kila mara kwa kawaida, maisha ya familia ya Waisraeli yalifanyika katika hewa. Wanawake walifanya kazi za kuchoma katika kambi; duka zilikuwa zinazofanana na kichwa cha barabara. Mawe ulitumika kwa kujenga nyumba. Hakuna maeneo yenye miti kubwa katika nchi ya Kanaani, hivyo mchanga ulikuwa na thamani kubwa.
ref: Katika hali joto ya hewa ya Mashariki ya Kati, nyumba haikuwa muhimu sana. Sehemu kubwa ya maisha ya familia ya Kiebrania ilifanyikia nje. Wanawake walifanya mapishi kwenye yadi; stoo zilikuwa kaunta wazi tu zilizoelekea barabarani. Mawe yalitumika kujengea barabara. Hakukua na misitu mikubwa kwenye ardhi ya Canaan, kwa hivyo mbao ziliuzwa kwa bei ghali mno.

src: Greenland was settled sparsely. In the Norse sagas they say that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder, and when travelling further west, found Greenland and named it Greenland. But regardless of his discovery, Eskimo tribes were already living there at the time. Though each country was 'Scandinavian', there were many differences between the people, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.
mt: Greenland ilikaa na wakazi wachache. Katika saga za Kaskazi wanasema Erik the Red alitolewa kutoka Iceland kwa kuhukumu kifo, na wakati wa kuendesha zaidi magharibi, alifika Greenland na jina lake lilikuwa Greenland. Lakini bila shaka, kabila la Eskimo lilikuwako huko wakati huo. Hata hivyo, kila nchi ilikuwa 'Kaskazi', kuna tofauti kubwa kati ya watu, wenyewe, desturi na historia ya Denmark, Sweden, Norway na Iceland.
ref: Greenland ilikuwa na watu chache. Katika Norse sagas wanasema kwamba Erik aliye Mwekundu alifukuzwa kutoka Iceland kwa mauaji, na wakati wa kusafiri Magharibi zaidi, aliipata Greenland na kuiita Greenland. Lakina licha ya ugunduzi wake, makabila ya Eskimo yalikuwa tayari yanaishi huko wakati huo. Ingawa kila nchi ilikuwa ya 'Kiskandinavia', kulikuwa na tofauti nyingi kati ya watu, wafalme, mila na historia za Denmaki, Uswidi, Norway na Aislandi.

src: While most of their food would be familiar to us, Romans did have their share of strange or unusual feast items, including wild boar, peacock, snails, and a type of rodent called a dormouse Another difference was that while the poor people and the woman ate their food while sitting in chairs, the rich men liked to have banquets together where they would lounge on their sides while they ate their meals. Ancient Roman meals couldn't have included foods that came to Europe from America or from Asia in later centuries. For instance, they didn't have corn, nor tomatoes, nor potatoes, nor cocoa, and no ancient Roman ever tasted a turkey.
mt: Kutokana na wengi wao chakula chao kinafahamika kwa sisi, wakaroma wakawashika chakula cha kawaida, kama vile wanyama wa kifaru, punda kiboko, nyama za kifua, na aina ya nyama za kifua kama vile dormouse. Jumuiya nyingine ilikuwa kwamba wakaroma wengi waliwacha wanao na wanawake waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye me
ref: Wakati nyingi ya vyakula vyao tunavifahamu, Warumi walikuwa na sehemu yao ya vitu vya karamu vya kushangaza au visivyo vya kawaida, pamoja na nguruwe mwitu, tausi, konokono, na aina ya panya inayoitwa dormouse Tofauti nyingine ilikuwa kwamba huku watu masikini na mwanamke wakila chakula chao huku wameketi kwenye viti, watu tajiri walipenda kuwa na karamu pamoja ambapo wangepumzika kwa upande huku wakila vyakula vyao. Milo ya kale ya Kiroma haingejumuisha vyakula vilivyoingia Uropa kutoka Marekani au kutoka Asia katika karne za baadaye. Kwa mfano, hawakuwa na mahindi, wala nyanya, wala viazi, wala kakao, na hakuna Mrumi wa zamani aliyewahi kuonja batamzinga.
