Jumuiya nyingine ilikuwa kwamba wakaroma wengi waliwacha wanao na wanawake waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye meza, wakaroma wazee waliwacha wanao wakifika kwenye me
ref: Wakati nyingi ya vyakula vyao tunavifahamu, Warumi walikuwa na sehemu yao ya vitu vya karamu vya kushangaza au visivyo vya kawaida, pamoja na nguruwe mwitu, tausi, konokono, na aina ya panya inayoitwa dormouse Tofauti nyingine ilikuwa kwamba huku watu masikini na mwanamke wakila chakula chao huku wameketi kwenye viti, watu tajiri walipenda kuwa na karamu pamoja ambapo wangepumzika kwa upande huku wakila vyakula vyao. Milo ya kale ya Kiroma haingejumuisha vyakula vilivyoingia Uropa kutoka Marekani au kutoka Asia katika karne za baadaye. Kwa mfano, hawakuwa na mahindi, wala nyanya, wala viazi, wala kakao, na hakuna Mrumi wa zamani aliyewahi kuonja batamzinga.

src: A civilization is a singular culture shared by a significant large group of people who live and work co-operatively, a society. The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society. City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilizational culture implies the passing on of knowledge across several generations, a lingering cultural footprint and fair dissemination. Minor cultures often vanish without leaving relevant historic evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.
mt: Ujenzi ni utamaduni mmoja ulio na umma mkubwa wa watu wanaoishi na kufanya kazi pamoja, jamii. Neno ujenzi kutoka kwa Kiingereza civilis, kwa maana ya kisiasa, kwa kuhusiana na Kiingereza civis, kwa maana ya raia, na civitas, kwa maana ya mji au mji-mkubwa, na inavyoainisha pia ukubwa wa jamii. Miji-mkubwa ni mababu ya nchi. Utamaduni wa jamii ni kujitolea kwa mawazo kwa zaidi ya kipindi cha miaka mingi, kipindi cha kujitolea cha utamaduni na usambazaji wa kutosha. Utamaduni mdogo mara nyingi hupotea bila kuweka maelezo ya kihistoria na hupatikana kama utamaduni wa kawaida.
ref: Ustaarabu ni utamaduni wa umoja unaoshirikiwa na kundi kubwa la watu wanaoishi na kufanya kazi kwa kushirikiana, jamii. Neno ustaarabu hutoka katika civilis la Kilatini, ambalo linamaanisha ya kiraia, linalohusiana na civis la Kilatini, linalomaanisha raia, na civitas, linalomaanisha mji au jimbo la mji, na ambalo kwa namna fulani linaelezea ukubwa wa jamii. Majimbo ya miji hutanguliza mataifa. Utamaduni wa kistaarabu huashiria kupitishwa kwa maarifa katika vizazi kadhaa, wayo wa kitamaduni unaoendelea kukaa kwa muda na usambazaji wenye haki. Tamaduni ndogo mara nyingi hutoweka bila kuacha ushahidi muhimu wa kihistoria na kukosa kutambuliwa kama ustaarabu barabara.

src: The Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper part of the Paro District (in Phondey Village). It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel created the fortress to commemorate his victory against the Tibetan-Mongol forces. In 1951, a fire caused for only some of the relics of the Drukgyal Dzong to remain, such as the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, remaining to be one of Bhutan's most sensational attractions.
mt: Drukgyal Dzong ni kabila la kuzimamoto na monasteri ya Buddha katika sehemu juu ya mkoa wa Paro (katika kijiji cha Phondey). Inasemekana kuwa mwaka 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel alianzisha kabila hilo ili kuadhimisha kufaulu kwa nguvu za Tibet-Mongolia. Mwaka 1951, moto ulisababisha kuendelea kwa kile kidogo cha reli za Drukgyal Dzong, kama vile picha ya Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. Baada ya moto, kabila hilo lilikuwa linapewa na kutunzwa, likawa moja kati ya vitu vikuu vya Bhutan.
ref: Drukgyal Dzong ni ngome iliyoharibika na monasteri ya Kibudhi katika sehemu ya juu ya Wilaya ya Paro (katika Kijiji cha Phondrey). Inasemekana kwamba mnamo 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel aliunda ngome hiyo kama ukumbusho wa ushindi wake dhidi ya vikosi vya Tibeti na Mongoli. Mnamo 1951, moto ulifanya baadhi tu ya masalio ya Drukgyal Dzong kubakia, kama vile picha ya Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. Baada ya moto, ngome ilihifadhiwa na kulindwa, na kubaki kuwa mojawapo ya vivutio vya kusisimua zaidi vya Bhutan.

src: During the 18th century Cambodia found itself squeezed between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Phen. In the last years of the 18th century the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.
mt: Kamili ya karne ya 18, Kambodia ilipata kuchukuliwa kwa wenzake wakuu, Thailand na Vietnam. Thai walivamia Kambodia mara nyingi katika miaka ya 18 na mwaka 1772 waliwafua Phnom Phen. Katika miaka ya mwisho ya karne ya 18, Vietnam pia walivamia Kambodia.
ref: Wakati wa karne ya 18 Kambodia ilijipata imebanwa katikati mwa majirani wawili wenye nguvu, Thailandi na Vietnam. Wathai walivamia Kambodia mara kadhaa katika karne ya 18 na mnamo 1772 wakaangamiza Phnom Phen. Katika miaka ya mwisho ya karne ya 18 Wavietinamu pia waliivamia Kambodia.

src: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island. In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.
mt: Taiwan kuanzia mwanzo kwa miaka ya 15 wakati wale waliokuwa wakiteka bahari waliorekodi jina la kisiwa hiki kama Ilha Formosa, au kisiwa kipya. Mwaka 1624, Kompya ya Mashariki ya Uholanzi inaanzisha kanda katika sehemu ya magharibi ya Taiwan, kuanzia mabadiliko katika mashamba ya kinywaji ya abalali na kutumia wafanyabiashara wa China kufanya kazi katika mashamba yake ya nazi na sukari. Mwaka 1683, nguvu za dola ya Qing (1644-1912) inaangusha sehemu za magharibi na mashariki ya Taiwan na kusema Taiwan kuwa kanda ya dola ya Qing. Mwaka 1885, dola ya Qing inaangusha Taiwan kama kanda ya dola yake. Mwaka 1895, baada ya kushindwa katika Vita ya Kwanza ya China na Japan (1894-1895), dola ya Qing inaandika mapatano ya Shimonoseki, kwa kufanya dola yake kuwa na utawala juu ya Taiwan hadi mwaka 1945.
ref: Taiwan ilianza nyuma kitambo katika karne ya 15 ambapo mabaharia wa Kiingereza wanaopita hurekodi jina la kisiwa hicho kama Ilha Formosa, au kisiwa kizuri. Mnamo 1624, kampuni ya Dutch East India ilianzisha msingi kusini magharibi mwa Taiwan, kuanzisha mabadiliko katika mazoea ya uzalishaji wa nafaka na kuwaajili wafanyakazi wa Kichina kufanya kazi kwenye mashamba ya mpunga na sukari. Mnamo 1683, vikosi vya nasaba ya Qing (1644-1912) vilichukua udhibiti wa maeneo ya pwani ya magharibi na kaskazini ya Taiwan na kutangaza Taiwan kama mkoa wa Milki ya Qing mnamo 1885. Mnamo 1895, baada ya kushindwa katika vita vya kwanza vya Sino-Japani (1894-1895), serikali ya Qing yatia sahihi mkataba wa Shimonoseki, ambao kwao inadhihirisha uhuru juu ya Taiwan hadi Japani, ambayo inaongoza kisiwa hadi 1945.

src: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice. The cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is. The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical. Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).
mt: Hii inaitwa pH ya kemia. Unaweza kutengeneza indicator kutumia maji ya mchicha. Maji ya mchicha yanachangia rangi kulingana na kiasi cha asidi au kibinadamu (alkaline) kemia. Kilele cha pH inajadiliwa na kiasi cha ioni za hidrojeni (H katika pH) katika kemia iliyotambuliwa. Ion hidrojeni ni protoni ambazo zimepindwa elektroni zao (kwa sababu atomi za hidrojeni zinahusika na protoni moja na elektroni moja).
ref: Hii inaitwa pH ya kemikali. Unaweza kutengeneza kiashiria kutumia juisi ya kabichi nyekundu. Sharubati ya kabichi hubadilisha rangi kulingana na uasidi au ubesi (ualkali) wa kemikali. Kiwango cha pH huashiriwa na kiasi cha ioni za Hidrojeni (H katika pH) kwenye kemikali iliyofanyiwa jaribio. Ioni za Hidrojeni ni protoni ambazo zilibambuliwa elektroni zazo (kwani atomu za Hidrojeni huwa na protoni moja na elektroni moja).

src: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides. Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs. The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters. Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.
mt: Simba ni kifaru cha kawaida, wanaishi katika kundi kubwa kama vile kundi la kifaru. ref: Simba ni baadhi ya wanyama wa jamii ya paka wanaopenda ujamii zaidi, na wanaishi katika vikundi vikubwa vinavyoitwa prides. Makundi ya simba yanatengenezwa na waume kati ya mmoja na watatu wazima wanaohusiana, pamoja na wengi wa kike kama thelathini na mashibli. Wanawake kawaida ndio uhusiana sana wao kwa wao, kwa kuwa familia kubwa ya madada na mabinti. Makundi ya simba hutenda kama makundi ya mbwa mwitu au mbwa, wanyama ambao kwa kushangaza ni sawa na simba (lakini si paka wengine wakubwa) kitabia, na pia ni hatari kwa mawindo yao.

src: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer. Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds. The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.
mt: Kati yao ni wanyama wadogo wengine wanaocheza chakula cha wanyama wadogo kama vile nyama, kongwe na punda. Kisha kuna wanyama wadogo wengi (kama vile wanyama wadogo wanaoishi kwa wakati) wanaocheza chakula cha wanyama wadogo kama vile wadudu, nyama, nyoka na ndege. Kitu kikuu kwa ushindi wao ni mifano ya nishati, kazi yoyote yoyote kila kiti inayokataza kushindana na wengine.
ref: Chini yake kunao paka zaidi zenye mwili wa wastani ambao hula mawindo yenye mwili wa wastani kuanzia sungura hadi swara na kulungu. Mwishowe, kuna paka wengi wadogo (wakiwemo paka huru vipenzi) ambao hula mawindo madogomadogo ambayo ni mengi, kama wadudu, panya, mijusi, na ndege. Siri ya mafanikio yao ni dhana ya niche, kazi maalum ambayo kila paka anashikilia na inayomzuia kushindana na wengine.

src: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer. Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds. The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.
mt: Kati yao ni wanyama wadogo wengine wanaocheza chakula cha wanyama wadogo kama vile nyama, kongwe na punda. Kisha kuna wanyama wadogo wengi (kama vile wanyama wadogo wanaoishi kwa wakati) wanaocheza chakula cha wanyama wadogo kama vile wadudu, nyama, nyoka na ndege. Kitu kikuu kwa ushindi wao ni mifano ya nishati, kazi yoyote yoyote kila kiti inayokataza kushindana na wengine.

Mwishowe, kuna paka wengi wadogo (wakiwemo paka huru vipenzi) ambao hula mawindo madogomadogo ambayo ni mengi, kama wadudu, panya, mijusi, na ndege. Siri ya mafanikio yao ni dhana ya niche, kazi maalum ambayo kila paka anashikilia na inayomzuia kushindana na wengine.

src: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is. Scientists think that ocelots follow and find animals to eat (prey) by smell, sniffing for where they've been on the ground. They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.
mt: Ocelots wanapenda kula wanyama wadogo. Wanaweza kula simba, makabila, wanyama wadogo na ndege kama wanaweza. Kila wanyama ambao ocelots wanavyo choma ni zaidi ya wao. Wanasayansi wanavyocheza kwamba ocelots wanavyo choma (wanyama wanao choma) kwa kutumia mdomo, kutumia mdomo kwa kutazama kwa mdomo, na kutumia mdomo kwa kutumia mdomo. ref: Paka mwitu hupenda kula wanyama wadogo. Hushika tumbili, nyoka, panya na ndege kama wanaweza. Karibu wanyama wote ambao paka mwitu huwinda ni wadogo kumliko. Wanasayansi wanafikiria kwamba paka mwitu hufuata na kutafuta wanyama wa kula (windo) kwa harufu, kunusa ili kutafuta walikokuwa ardhini. Wanaweza kuona vizuri sana kwa giza na maono ya usiku pia wanasonga kwa kimya sana. Ocelots huwinda mawindo yao kwa kujichanganya na mazingira yao kasha kurukia mawindo yao.

src: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human. The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar. The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.
mt: Atleti mwenye kipaji kamilifu, panya anaweza kufika (hakuna kipaji), kuzimba, kufika kwa masafa kubwa na kupuliza na kipaji chafu cha binadamu. Panya ni katika kundi (Jenusi Panthera) kama vile panya, panya na panya. Kama vile panya, panya na panya ndio pekee wanaocheza. Panya anacheza kama kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujivu, kifungu cha kujiv
ref: Mwanariadha wa mambo anuwai, simbamarara anaweza kupanda (ingawa si vizuri), kuogelea, kuruka mbali sana na kuvuta kwa nguvu mara tano ya zile za mwanamume mwenye nguvu. Chui yuko kwenye kundi moja (jenasi panther) na simba, lengau na chui wa America ya kusini na kati. Hawa paka wanne pekee ndio wanaoweza kunguruma. Mgurumo wa simbamarara si kama mgurumo mkubwa wa simba, bali ni zaidi kama sentensi ya kemeo yenye maneno yanayotolewa kwa kelele.

src: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of a living (things) organism. Cell comes from the Latin word cella which means small room. If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made of small squares or balls. Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small squares in cork with a microscope. They looked like rooms. He was the first person to observe dead cells
mt: Selini ni kifaa cha kutosha na kifaa cha kazi cha kawaida ya mnyama (mnyama) mwenye maisha. Selini inatokana na maneno ya Kijerumani cella ambayo inamaanisha chumba cha ndani. Kama unavyoangalia mnyama (mnyama) kwa mikroskopia, utakuta kwamba yalitengenezwa kwa kifaa cha kutosha au kifaa cha kazi. Robert Hooke, mwanabiolojia kutoka Uingereza, aliona kifaa cha kutosha katika kivuli na mikroskopia. Kifaa cha kutosha ilikuwa kama chumba. Alikuwa mtu wa kwanza kufanya utambuzi wa seli za kufa
ref: Seli ni sehemu ndogo ya kimuundo na ya kazi ya viumbe (vitu) hai. Seli linatokana na neno cella la Kilatini ambalo humaanisha chumba kidogo. Ukitazama vitu vyenye uhai chini ya hadubini, utaona kwamba vimeudwa kwa miraba au mipira midogo. Robert Hooke, mtaalamu wa biolojia kutoka Uingereza, aliona miraba midogo kwenye kizibo kwa darubini. Zilionekana kama vyumba. Alikuwa mtu wa kwanza kuona seli zilizokufa.

src: Animals are made of many cells. They eat things and digest them inside. Most animals can move. Only animals have brains (though not even all animals do; jellyfish, for example, do not have brains). Animals are found all over the earth. They dig in the ground, swim in the oceans, and fly in the sky.

src: Plants make oxygen which humans breathe, and they take in carbon-dioxide which humans exhale (that is, breathe out). Plants make their food from the sun by photosynthesis. They also provide shade. We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.

src: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before. This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before. The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species. We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.
mt: Kama kundi chenye wanyama wadogo (kundi la wanyama kidogo) linapata kujitenga kutoka kwa kundi la wanyama kikubwa ambacho waliwahi kutoka (kama wanaingia kwenye mlima au mto, au kama wanaingia kwenye kisiwa ambako wao hawawezi kufika tena) wataendelea kupata mazingira tofauti na yale ambayo waliyokuwa wakiishi kabla. Mazingira haya mpya yana mali na mashambuliaji tofauti, hivyo kundi la wanyama la kwanza litaendelea kupata vipaji na mabadiliko vya kawaida ambavyo watahitaji kama mashambuliaji wao wakubwa, wakati kundi la wanyama la kwanza hata hivyo hawatahitaji vipaji na mabadiliko hivyo. Kwa muda, wakati kundi la wanyama la kwanza linaanza kupata vipaji na mabadiliko kwa mazingira yao, wataanza kuonekana kama wanyama wengine. Baadae, kwa miaka elfu au zaidi, kundi la wanyama la kwanza litaonekana kama wanyama wengine, hivyo hawatahitaji kama wanyama wengine. Tukio hili hutokea kwa sababu ya evolusheni, ambayo ni kipindi cha kujitenga kwa wanyama wadogo kutoka kwa wanyama wakubwa, ambao ni kipindi cha kujitenga kwa wanyama wadogo kutoka kwa wanyama wakubwa, ambao ni kipindi cha kujitenga kwa wanyama wadogo kutoka kwa wanyama wakubwa, ambao ni kipindi cha kujitenga kwa wanyama wadogo kutoka kwa wanyama wakubwa, ambao ni kipindi cha kujitenga kwa wanyama wadogo kutoka kwa wanyama wakub
ref: Wakati kundi dogo la vitu vilivyo hai (idadi ndogo) linatenganishwa na idadi kubwa walimotoka (kama wakipita juu ya milima au mto, au wakihamia kwenye kisiwa kigeni hivi kwamba hawawezi kurudi nyuma kwa urahisi) mara nyingi watajipata katika mazingira tofauti na walimokuwa awali. Mazingira haya mapya yana rasilimali tofauti na washindani tofauti, kwa hivyo idadi mpya ya watu itahitaji vipengele au mazoea tofauti ili kuwa washindani imara kuliko walichohitaji awali. Idadi asili haijabadilika kamwe, bado wanahitaji mbinu zile zile za za awali. Kwa muda, jinsi idadi mpya inavyoanza kuzoea mazingira yao mapya, wanaanza kuonekana zaidi na zaidi tofauti na idadi ile nyingine. Mwishowe, baada ya maelfu au hata mamilioni ya miaka, wakazi hao wawili wataonekana tofauti sana kwamba hawawezi kuitwa spishi moja. Tunauita mchakato huu speciation, ambalo linamanisha uundaji wa spishi mpya. Speciation ni matokeo yasiyoweza kuepukika na sehemu muhimu sana ya mageuzi.

src: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before. This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before. The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species. We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.

src: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood. Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.
mt: Juu ya organa kuu ya mfumo wa damu ni miili, ambayo inipima damu. Damu inapotea kutoka miili kwa majiko ya kawaida ya kujaza damu na kufika tena miili kwa majiko ya kawaida ya kupata damu. Majiko ya kawaida ya kujaza damu ni majiko ya kawaida ya kupata damu.
ref: Kiungo kikuu cha mfumo wa mzunguko ni moyo, ambao hupiga damu. Damu inatoka moyoni katika mirija inayoitwa ateri na inarudi moyoni katika mirija inayoitwa vena. Mirija midogo kabisa huitwa kapilari.

src: Insects were the first animals to take to the air. Their ability to fly helped them evade enemies more easily and find food and mates more efficiently. Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back along the body. This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators. Today, the only insects that cannot fold back their wings are dragon flies and mayflies.

src: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds. Many people don't think about them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur. They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.
mt: Wengi wa wanasayansi wa nyuki leo wanamwamini kwamba moja kati ya kundi la dinozoria waliendelea na kuwa wameishi hadi leo. Tunawajua kama ndizo wanyama. Wengi hawajui kama ndizo dinozoria kwa sababu wanazunguka na kupumzika na wana ngozi na kipaji cha kupumzika. Lakini kuna mengi kuhusu wanyama wanaosimama kama ndizo dinozoria. Wanazunguka na ngozi na kipaji cha kupumzika, wanazaa mayai, na wanazunguka kwa miguu yao yale mbili kama T-Rex.
ref: Wanapaleontolojia wengi leo hii wanaamini kuwa kikundi kimoja cha dinosau kiliponea na kingali hai hata sasa. Tunawaita ndege. Watu wengi hawawachukuliii kuwa dinosau kwa sababu wana manyoya na wanaweza kupaa. Lakini kuna mambo mengi juu ya ndege ambao bado wanaonekana kama dinosau. Wana miguu yenye magamba na makucha, hutaga mayai na hutembea kwa miguu yake miwili ya nyuma kama T-Rex.

src: A triceratops' teeth would have been able to crush not only leaves but even very tough branches and roots. Some scientists think Triceratops ate cycads, which are a type of plant that was common in the Cretaceous. These plants look like a small palm tree with a crown of sharp, spiky leaves. A Triceratops could have used its strong beak to strip off the leaves before eating the trunk. Other scientists argue that these plants are very poisonous so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, even though today the sloth and other animals like the parrot (a descendant of the dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.
mt: Zimua za triceratops zingeweza kuchoma isipokuwa majani bali pia mabonde na mabonde mengi. Wanasayansi wengine wanasema Triceratops alikuwa anaeziwa cycads, ambayo ni aina ya mimea iliyokuwepo katika Cretaceous. src: Italy's national football, along with German national football team is the second most successful team in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and F1 motor racing. Winter sports are most popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.
mt: Timu ya mpira wa miguu ya Italia, pamoja na timu ya mpira wa miguu ya Ujerumani ni timu inayoshinda zaidi katika dunia na walishinda mechi ya kifedha ya FIFA mwaka 2006. Michezo maarufu ni pamoja na kandanda, mpira wa kikapu, mpira wa wavu, polo ya majini, mchezo wa uzio, raga, uendeshaji baiskeli, hoki ya barafu, hoki ya gogo na mashindano ya magari ya F1. Spoti za msimu wa baridi ni maarufu sana katika maeneo ya Kaskazini, ambako Waitaliano hushindana katika michezo ya kimataifa na ya Olimpiki.

src: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839. Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany. In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization which is today known as the European Union.
mt: Ufalme wa Luxembourg unahistoria mrefu lakini uhuru wake unadate kwa mwaka 1839. Sehemu za sasa za Ubelgiji zilikuwa sehemu za Luxembourg katika mazingira ya mapinduzi ya 1830 ya Ubelgiji. Luxembourg imekuwa kila wakati kama nchi isiyotumia nguvu lakini ilikabiliwa na Ujerumani katika Vita vya Kwanza na Vita vya Pili. Mwaka 1957 Luxembourg ilikuwa mwanachama wa kwanza wa kikundi kilichokaa sasa kama Shirika la Umoja wa Ulaya.
ref: Luxembourg ina historia ndefu lakini uhuru wake ni wa kutoka mwaka wa 1839. Baadhi ya sehemu za sasa za Ubelgiji zilikuwa sehemu ya Lusembagi zamani lakini zikawa za Kibelgiji baada ya Mapinduzi ya Kibelgiji ya 1830. Lusembagi daima imejaribu kuwa nchi isiyoegemea upande wowote lakini ilichukuliwa na Ujerumani katika Vita vya kwanza na vya pili vya Dunia. Mnamo 1957 Luxembourg ikawa memba mwanzilishi wa shirika ambalo leo linajulikana kama Umoja wa Ulaya.

src: European Turkey (eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan peninsula) includes 3% of the country. The territory of Turkey is more than 1,600 kilometres (1,000 mi) long and 800 km (500 mi) wide, with a roughly rectangular shape. Turkey's area, including lakes, occupies 783,562 square kilometres (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 square kilometres (291,773 sq mi) are in south west Asia and 23,764 square kilometres (9,174 sq mi) in Europe. Turkey's area makes it the world's 37th-largest country, and is about the size of Metropolitan France and the United Kingdom combined. Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.
mt: Turuki ya Ulaya (Thrace ya Mashariki au Rumelia katika kisiwa cha Balkani) inaangalia 3% ya nchi. Eneo la nchi ya Turuki ni zaidi ya kilomita 1,600 (1,000 mi) na kilomita 800 (500 mi) kwa wingi, na ujazo wa kifungu. Eneo la Turuki, ikiwemo maji, linaangalia 783,562 kilomita za mraba (300,948 sq mi), ambayo 755,688 kilomita za mraba (291,773 sq mi) ni katika mashariki ya Asia na 23,764 kilomita za mraba (9,174 sq mi) katika Ulaya. Eneo la Turuki linaangalia nchi ya 37 kwa dunia, na ni kama kiasi cha nchi za Ufaransa na Uingereza zilizokatika. Turuki inakabiliwa na bahari kwa wingu wawili: Bahari ya Aegea kwa mashariki, Bahari ya Kati kwa kaskazini na Bahari ya Kati kwa kusini.
ref: Uturuki ya Ulaya (Thrace mashariki au Rumelia katika rasi ya Balka) inajumuisha asilimia 3 ya nchi. Wilaya ya Uturuki ni zaidi ya kilomita 1,600 (maili 1,000) urefu na kilomita 800 (maili 500) upana, na takriban umbo la mstatili. Sehemu ya Uturuki, pamoja na maziwa, imekalia kilomita mraba 783, 562 (maili mraba 300, 948), ambazo kilomita mraba 755,688 (maili mraba 291,773) kati yake ziko kusini magharibi mwa Asia na kilomita mraba 23,764 (maili mraba 9,174) ziko barani Ulaya. Eneo la Uturuki huifanya kuwa nchi ya 37 kwa ukubwa duniani, na ina takriban saizi za Ufaransa ya Uropa na Uingereza kwa pamoja. Uturuki imezungukwa na maziwa katika pande tatu: Bahari ya Aegea upande wa magharibi, Bahari Nyeusi upande wa kaskazini na Bahari ya Mediterania upande wa kusini.

src: Vatican City's population is around 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population. Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications. Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.
mt: Ufalme wa Vatikani unakadiriwa kuwa 800. Ni nchi ndogo zaidi ya kujitegemea duniani na nchi yenye wakazi wadogo zaidi. Ufalme wa Vatikani unatumia Kiswahili katika sheria zake na mapambano rasmi. Kiswahili pia ni lugha ya kila siku inayotumika na wengi wengi wanaoajiriwa katika nchi hiyo, na Kiswahili pia linaendelea kutumika katika majadiliano rasmi. Wote wanaoishi katika Ufalme wa Vatikani ni Wakatoliki.
ref: Idadi ya watu Jijini Vatican ni takriban 800. Ndio taifa ndogo kabisa duniani lililo huru na nchi yenye idadi ndogo kabisa ya watu. Jiji la Vatikani hutumia Kiitaliano katika sheria zake na mawasiliano rasmi. Kiitaliano pia ni lugha ya kila siku inayotumika na wengi wa wale wanaofanya kazi katika serikali huku Kilatini mara nyingi kikitumika katika sherehe za kidini. Wananchi wote wa Mji wa Vatican ni Wakatoliki ya Kiroma.

src: Computers today are used to manipulate pictures and videos. Sophisticated animations can be constructed on computers, and this kind of animation is increasingly being used in television and films. Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers to process and mix sounds together.
mt: Kwa sasa, vifaa vya kielektroniki vinavyotumika kwa kujenga picha na video. Uchafuzi wa picha na video unaweza kujengwa kwa vifaa vya kielektroniki, na huu kifaa cha kujenga picha unavyotumika zaidi katika televisheni na filamu. Pia, muziki unaweza kurekodiwa kwa vifaa vya kielektroniki vinavyotumia vifaa vya kielektroniki kuchanganya na kushirikiana.
ref: Tarakilishi leo hutumiwa kuumbua picha na video. Michoro ya kisasa inaweza kujengwa kwenye kompyuta, na aina hii ya uhuishaji inazidi kutumiwa kwenye runinga na filamu. Muziki kwa kawaida hurekodiwa kutumia kompyuta tata ili kuchakata na kuchanganya sauti pamoja.

src: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system. Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece. There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.
mt: Miji ya Harappa na Mohenjo-daro ilikuwa na kifaa cha kuzimia kila nyumba, chini ya mfumo wa kisasa wa kuzimia. Mfumo wa kuzimia ulitambuliwa katika nyumba za miji ya Minoan ya Kreta na Santorini nchini Ugiriki. Kuna pia kifaa cha kuzimia katika utamaduni wa Misri, Uajemi na China. Katika utamaduni wa Roma, kifaa cha kuzimia kilitambuliwa mara nyingi katika vyumba vya bafu vya kijiji ambako wanaume na wanawake walikuwa pamoja katika kundi cha kawaida.
ref: Miji ya Harappa na Mohenjo-daro ilikuwa na choo cha kisasa katika karibu kila nyumba, kilichounganishwa kwenye mfumo tata wa maji taka. Mabaki ya mfumo wa maji taka yamepatikana kwenye nyumba za miji ya Kiminoa ya Crete na Santorini katika Ugiriki. Pia kulikuwa na choo katika Misri, Uajemi na China ya kale. Katika ustaarabu wa Kirumi, wakati mwingine choo zilikuwa sehemu ya nyumba za bafu za umma ambapo waume na wake walichanganyika pamoja.

src: The blade on a modern ice skate has a double edge with a concave hollow between them. The two edges allow for a better grasp of the ice, even when tilted. Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, as the blade tilts to one side or the other, the edge which is in contact with the ice also curves. This causes the skater to turn. If the skates tilt to the right, the skater turns right, if the skates tilt to the left, the skater turns left.

Kwa sababu ukengele umepindika kidogo upande wa chini, jinsi ukengele unavyoelekea upande mmoja au mwingine, ncha ambayo inaambatana na barafu pia inajipinda. Hii husababisha mtelezaji kugeuka. src: "To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the extra energy they got from the light. They do this by emitting a tiny particle of light called a ""photon"". Scientists call this process ""stimulated emission of radiation"" because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation. The next picture shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality photons are a lot smaller than those in the picture. Photons are even smaller than the stuff that makes up atoms!"
mt: "Kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena
ref: "Ili kurejea katika hali yao ya awali ya nishati, ni lazima ziondoe nishati ya ziada zilizopata kutoka kwa mwangaza. Hufanya hivi kwa kutoa chembe ndogo ya mwanga inayoitwa “fotoni”. Wanasayansi huita mchakato huu ""utoaji wa mionzi uliosisimuliwa"" kwani atomu husisimuliwa na mwanga mkali, na kusababisha utoaji wa fotoni ya mwanga, na mwanga ni aina ya mionzi. Picha inayofuata inaonyesha atomu zikitoa fotoni. Kwa hakika, katika hali halisi fotoni ni ndogo zaidi kuliko zile zilizo kwenye picha. Fotoni ni ndogo hata kuliko vitu vinavyotengeneza atomu!"

Scientists call this process ""stimulated emission of radiation"" because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation. The next picture shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality photons are a lot smaller than those in the picture. Photons are even smaller than the stuff that makes up atoms!"
mt: "Kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena tena nafasi yao ya kina, wanaenda kwa kutumia tena
ref: "Ili kurejea katika hali yao ya awali ya nishati, ni lazima ziondoe nishati ya ziada zilizopata kutoka kwa mwangaza. Hufanya hivi kwa kutoa chembe ndogo ya mwanga inayoitwa “fotoni”. Wanasayansi huita mchakato huu ""utoaji wa mionzi uliosisimuliwa"" kwani atomu husisimuliwa na mwanga mkali, na kusababisha utoaji wa fotoni ya mwanga, na mwanga ni aina ya mionzi. Picha inayofuata inaonyesha atomu zikitoa fotoni. Kwa hakika, katika hali halisi fotoni ni ndogo zaidi kuliko zile zilizo kwenye picha. Fotoni ni ndogo hata kuliko vitu vinavyotengeneza atomu!"

src: After hundreds of hours of operation the filament in the bulb eventually burns out and the light bulb no longer works. The light bulb then needs replacing. It is necessary to be careful in replacing the light bulb. First, the switch for the light fixture needs to be turned off or the cable disconnected. This is because electricity flowing into the socket where the metallic part of bulb sits can give you a severe electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb while it is still partly in the socket.
mt: Baada ya saa zaidi ya miaka 100 ya kufanya kazi, filameni katika jiko la mawingu kwa mara moja hulipuka na jiko hilo hauwezi kufanya kazi tena. Jiko hilo lazima liwekezwe tena. Ni lazima kujitahidi sana katika kuwekeza jiko hilo. Kwanza, kipande cha kawaida cha jiko hilo lazima liwekezwe au kifurushi cha kabuli kifurushiwe. Hii ni kwa sababu umeme unaofika katika kifurushi cha kabuli ambako sehemu ya metali ya jiko hilo inasitishwa, inaweza kutoa shocki wa umeme mkubwa kama unavyoleta sehemu ya ndani ya kifurushi au sehemu ya metali ya jiko hilo wakati huo huo hauyekuwa kabisa katika kifurushi.
ref: Baada ya mamia ya saa za operesheni, hatimaye uzi wa balbu unaungua na balbu ya nuru haiwezi kufanya kazi tena. Balbu ya mwanga basi inahitaji kubadilishwa. Ni muhimu kuwa na uangalifu wakati wa kuibadilisha balbu ya mwanga. Kwanza, swichi ya taa nyepesi inahitaji kuzimwa au waya kutengwa. Hii ni kwa sababu umeme unaopita ndani ya soketi ambamo sehemu ya metali ya balbu hukaa unaweza kukupa mshtuko mkubwa wa umeme ukikugusa sehemu ya ndani ya soketi ama sehemu ya metali ya balbu ikiwa bado ina sehemu iliyobakia kwenye tundu.

src: The fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to put together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons. Sort of like rolling a heavy cart up a hill. Splitting the nucleus up again then releases some of that energy. Some atoms have unstable nuclei which means that they tend to break apart with little or no nudging.
mt: Bombi la fisi hutoa mifumo ya kuwa kwamba inaweza kutumia nishati kwa kutengeneza nuklea na protoni na neutroni. Kama kuchanganya gari kubwa kwa kuchanganya mila. Kupata nuklea kwa kutengeneza tena inaweza kutupa nishati. Atomi nyingi zinaweza kutengeneza nuklea ambazo zinazoelekea kupata nishati kwa kutengeneza tena bila au na nishati kubwa.
ref: Bomu hii gawanyiki hufanya kazi kwa kanuni kwamba nguvu huhitajika katika uundaji wa viini vyenye protoni na nutroni nyingi. Kama vile kuviringisha rukwama nzito kuelekea mlimani. Kugawanya nyuklia mara nyingine tena kisha kutoa baadhi ya nishati hiyo. Atomu zingine huwa na viini visivyo imara kwa maana kwamba huwa na mazoea ya kuachana hata kwa mguso kidogo tu.

src: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite. The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly. The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth’s atmosphere distorts some of our light and view. It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.
mt: Kama unajua mtu ambaye anafika zaidi ya kilometa 1000, unatumia satelaiti. Satelaiti huko juu ya anga inapata wakati na kisha kubadilisha kwa kasi. Satelaiti ilipewa anga na roketi. Wanasayansi wana kutumia teleskopi angani kwa sababu anga la dunia linadondoa sehemu za nuru yetu na picha. Inaweza kuchukua roketi kubwa zaidi ya 100 futi kwa kutupa satelaiti au teleskopi angani.
ref: Unapompigia simu mtu aliye mbali maelfu ya maili, unatumia satelaiti. Setilaiti iliyo angani hupata simu kisha inaiakisi tena chini, karibu papo hapo. Setalaiti ilitumwa angani kwa kutumia roketi. Wanasayansi hutumia darubini angani kwa sababu anga ya dunia huvuruga sehemu ya nuru na mtazamo wetu. Huhitaji roketi kubwa yenye urefu wa zaidi ya futi 100 kuweka setalaiti au darubini angani.

src: Time is something that is all around us, and affects everything we do, yet is difficult to understand. Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past. Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events. You can mark the passing of time yourself by observing the repetition of a cyclical event. A cyclical event is something that happens again and again regularly.
mt: Wakati ni kitu ambacho kinakaa kila wakati, na kinachangamka kila kitu tunachofanya, lakini kinachokosa kutambuliwa. Wakati umetambuliwa na wataalamu wa dini, falsafa, na sayansi kwa miaka elfu nyingi. Tunavyo wakati kama mifumo ya magazeti yanayopita kutoka kwa mapitio ya kesho hadi mapitio ya zamani. Wakati ni pia jinsi tunavyo kuzingatia muda (uzito) ya magazeti. Unaweza kuzingatia wakati wako mwenyewe kwa kutambua mara nyingi ya magazeti yanayofanyika tena na tena kwa kawaida.
ref: Wakati ni kitu ambacho kinatuzingira, na huathiri kila kitu tunachofanya, lakini ni ngumu kuelewa. Wakati umesomwa na wasomi wa kidini, kifalsafa, na kisayansi kwa maelfu ya miaka. Sisi hupata saa kama msururu wa matukio unaopita kutoka wakati ujao kupitia wakati uliopo hadi kwenye wakati uliopita. Saa pia ni jinsi tunavyolinganisha kipindi (urefu) cha matukio. Unaweza kuweka alama ya upitaji wa saa wewe mwenyewe kwa kuangalia marudio ya tukio la kimzunguko. Tukio la kimzunguko ni kitu ambacho hutukia tena na tena mara nyingi.

src: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing school. However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.
mt: Kwa kawaida, mwanamke wa kwanza wa kifalme alikuwa anapata mafunzo ya kijiji baada ya kufikia shule. Lakini Charles alifika chuo kikuu katika Chuo Kikuu cha Trinity, Cambridge ambako alifundisha Utamaduni na Uchumi wa Kazi, na baadaye Historia, akapata daraja la pili (daraja chini ya pili). Charles alikuwa mwanamke wa kwanza wa familia ya kifalme wa Uingereza kufundishwa daraja.
ref: Kitamaduni, mrithi wa kiti cha enzi angeenda moja kwa moja kwa uanajeshi baada ya kuhitimu shuleni. Walakini, Charles alienda katika Trinity College, Cambridge mahali alisomea Anthropolojia na Akiolojia, na baadaye Historia, akapokea 2:2 (shahada ya pili kutoka chini). Charles alikuwa memba wa kwanza wa Familia ya Kifalme ya Kiingereza kuzawadiwa shahada ya digrii.

src: England had experienced a long period of peace after the reconquest of the Danelaw. However in 991 Ethelred was faced with a Viking fleet larger than any since Guthrum's a century earlier. This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to reclaim his country from Danish domination. After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to agree to terms with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to gain his kingdom with mixed success.
mt: Ingereza ilikuwa imepata muda mrefu wa amani baada ya kurejesha Danelaw. Lakini katika mwaka 991 Ethelred alipata jeshi la Vikingi kubwa kuliko yoyote tangu Guthrum miaka 100 iliyopita. Jeshi hili lilielekezwa na Olaf Trygvasson, Norwejia na alikuwa na mapambano ya kujenga nchi yake kutoka kwa utawala wa Denmark.
ref: Uingereza ilikuwa na uzoefu wa kipindi kirefu cha amani baada ya kushinda upya Danelaw. Walakini mnamo 991 Ethelred alikabiliwa na kundi la manowari la Viking kubwa kuliko lolote tangu la Guthrum karne moja mapema. Manowari hizi ziliongozwa na Olaf Trygvasson, Mnorwei aliye na matarajio ya kurudisha nchi yake kutoka kwa utawala wa Kidenmaki. Baada ya vipingamizi vya kwanza vya kijeshi, Ethelred aliweza kukubaliana kimasharti na Olaf, ambaye alirudi Norwe ili kujaribu kupata ufalme wake, kwa mafanikio mseto.

src: "Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was under great cultural influence of Germany. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the native people, so they invented the Estonian literal language. It was based on the German alphabet and one character ""Õ/õ"" was added. As time passed, many words that were borrowed from German coalesced. This was the beginning of enlightenment."
mt: "Kati ya karne ya 15, Estonia ya kaskazini ilikuwa chini ya mabadiliko ya kisiasa ya Ujerumani. Wamonaki wa Ujerumani walitaka kufanya Mungu aendelee kufanya kazi kwa wakazi wanaoishi huko, hivyo wakajenga lugha ya kitala ya Estonia. Ilianzishwa kwa alfabeti ya Ujerumani na moja kati ya herufi "Õ/õ" ilipatikana. Kama muda ulipita, maneno mengi yaliyotokana na Ujerumani yalipanuka. Hii ilikuwa mwanzo wa maendeleo."
ref: "Karibu karne ya 15, Estonia kaskazini ilikuwa chini ya ushawishi mkubwa wa kiutamaduni wa Ujerumani. Watawa wengine wa Kijerumani walitaka kumleta Mungu karibu na watu asili, kwa hivyo wakabuni lugha halisi ya Kiestonia Ilihusishwa na alfabeti ya kijerumani na alfabeti moja ""Õ/õ"" ikaongezwa. Kadiri muda ulivyopita, maneno mengi yaliyoombwa kutoka Ujerumani yalichanganyika. Huu ulikuwa mwanzo wa uelewa."

src: There are varying estimates for how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most commonly spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies depending on whether or not very closely related dialects are counted. Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, and as many as 800 million people can understand the language. Hindi and Urdu are similar in vocabulary but different in script; in everyday conversations, speakers of both languages can usually understand each other.
mt: Kuna takwimu tofauti kuhusu walezi wa Kiswahili. Inaangazwa kuwa kati ya kwanza na tatu kwa lugha zinazotumika zaidi duniani. Takwimu za walezi wanaotumia Kiswahili kama lugha yao ya kwanza zinavarya kati ya milioni 340 hadi milioni 500, na walezi wengi wanaoweza kuelewa Kiswahili ni milioni 800.
ref: Kuna makadirio yanayotofautiana kuhusu idadi ya watu wanaozungumza Kihindi. Inakadiriwa kuwa kati ya lugha nambari mbili na nne inayozungumzwa zaidi duniani. Idadi ya wazungumzaji wenyeji hutofautiana kulingana na kama lahaja zinazohusiana kwa karibu sana zinahesabiwa au la. Makadirio yanafikia wasemaji milioni 340 hadi milioni 500, na watu wengi kama milioni 800 wanaweza kuielewa lugha hiyo. Kihindi na Kiurdu zinafanana kwa msamiati lakini tofauti katika hati; katika mazungumzo ya kila siku, wazungumzaji wa lugha zote mbili wanaweza kuelewana.

src: "Hangeul is the only purposely invented alphabet in popular daily use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 – 1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most highly regarded. He originally named the Hangeul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means ""the correct sounds for the instruction of the people""."
mt: "Hangeul ni alfabeti pekee ambayo imeundwa kwa ajili ya kujituma. Alfabeti huo ulitengenezwa mwaka 1444 wakati wa ukasi wa Mfalme Sejong (1418 – 1450). Mfalme Sejong alikuwa mfalme wa nne wa Dola la Joseon na ni mmoja wa wale wanaoendelea kwa ajili ya kujituma. Alitaja alfabeti huo Hunmin Jeongeum, ambayo inamaanisha ""maudhui sahihi kwa ajili ya kusimamia watu""."
ref: Hangeul ndiyo alfabeti ya kipekee iliyovumbuliwa kimakusudi inayotumika kimaarufu kila siku. Alfabeti hiyo ilivumbuliwa mwaka wa 1444 wakati wa utawala wa Mfalme Sejong (1418 – 1450). Mfalme Sejong alikua ndiye mfalme wa nne kwenye Nasaba ya Joseon na ndiye aliyezingatiwa Zaidi. Mwanzoni aliipatia alfabeti ya Hangeul jina la Hunmin Jeongeum, kumaanisha “sauti sahihi za maagizo kwa watu”.

Mfalme Sejong alikua ndiye mfalme wa nne kwenye Nasaba ya Joseon na ndiye aliyezingatiwa Zaidi. Mwanzoni aliipatia alfabeti ya Hangeul jina la Hunmin Jeongeum, kumaanisha “sauti sahihi za maagizo kwa watu”.

src: There are many theories to how Sanskrit came into existence. One of them is about an Aryan migration from the west into India who brought their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language and is comparable to the Latin language spoken in Europe. The earliest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the compilation of Upanishads, Sanskrit just faded due to hierarchy. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which has served to be the source for many modern Indian languages, just like Latin is the source for European languages like French and Spanish.
mt: Kuna mambo mengi yanayotajwa kuhusu kwanini Kisaniki ilipatikana. Moja yao ni kuhusu migogoro ya Aryan kutoka mashariki mwa dunia kuelekea India wakati wao waliingia na lugha yao. Kisaniki ni lugha ya kale na inaweza kujadiliwa kama lugha ya Kijerumani ilivyo. Kitabu cha awali cha kwanza kuchapishwa katika lugha ya Kisaniki. Baada ya kuchapisha Upanishad, Kisaniki kiliacha kutumika kwa sababu ya utawala. Kisaniki ni lugha yenye upe na yenye uzoefu, ambayo imekuwa chanzo cha lugha nyingi za India za sasa, kama vile Kijerumani ni chanzo cha lugha za Ulaya kama vile Kifaransa na Kihispania.
ref: Kuna nadharia nyingi kuhusu vile Sanskrit ilikuja kuwepo. Mojawapo ni kuhusu uhamaji wa Aryan kutoka magharibi hadi India waliokuja na lugha yao. Sanskrit ni lugha ya kale na inaweza kulinganishwa na lugha ya Kilatini inayozungumzwa Uropa. Kitabu cha mapema zaidi kijulikanacho duniani kiliandikwa kwa Sanskrit. Baada ya utungaji wa Upanishads, Sanskrit ilififia tu kwa sababu ya mfumo wa viwango. Sanskrit ni lugha tata na tajiri sana, ambayo imekuwa chanzo cha lugha nyingi za kisasa za Kihindi, kama vile Kilatini ilivyo chanzo cha lugha za Kizungu kama vile Kifaransa na Kispanya.

src: How would Io's gravity pull on me? If you stood on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than you do on Earth. A person who weighs 200 pounds (90kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16kg) on Io. So the gravity, of course, pulls less on you.
mt: Je nini kama graviti ya Io inavyopiga kwa mimi? Kama unakaa juu ya nchi ya Io, utakaa chini kuliko ulivyo juu ya Dunia. Mtu anayeweza 200 paundi (90kg) juu ya Dunia anaweza kufikia 36 paundi (16kg) juu ya Io. Kwa hiyo graviti, kwa kawaida, inapiga kwa zaidi.
ref: Mvuto wa lo ungewezaje kunivuta? Kama ungesimama katika uso wa lo, ungekuwa na uzani mdogo kuliko ulionao duniani. Mtu aliye na uzito wa pauni 200 (kilogramu 90) duniani anaweza kuwa na uzito wa pauni 36 (kilogramu 16) kwenye lo. Kwa hivyo mvuto, bila shaka, huvuta kidogo sana kwako.

src: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side. It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands. There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.
mt: Jua la Mwezi ni chenye mawe na majivu. Njia ya nje ya Mwezi inaitwa kivuli. Kivuli ni kama 70 km kwenye mabonde na 100 km kwenye mabonde. Ni mepesi zaidi kwenye mabonde na zaidi kwenye mabonde. Kuna zaidi mabonde kwenye mabonde kwa sababu kivuli ni mepesi. Ilikuwa rahisi zaidi kwa majivu kufika juu ya sura.
ref: Uso wa mwezi umeundwa kwa mawe na vumbi. Safu ya nje ya mwezi hujulikana kama ganda. Uso wa dunia una upana wa karibu kilomita 70 kwa ukaribu na upana wa kilomita100 kwa umbali. Chini ya maria huwa nyembamba lakini nzito chini ya nyanda za juu. Kunaweza kuwa na maria zaidi upande wa karibu kwa sababu ganda huwa jembamba. Ilikuwa rahisi kwa lava kupanda juu hadi usoni.

src: "Many people dream of the day when humans can travel to another star and explore other worlds, some people wonder what's out there some belive that aliens or other life may live on another plant. But, if this ever does happen probably won't happen for a very long time. The stars are so spread out that there are trillions of miles between stars that are ""neighbors"". Maybe one day, your great grandchildren will be standing atop an alien world wondering about their ancient ancestors?"
mt: "Wengi wanaendela siku ambapo binadamu waweze kuendesha ndege kwenye nyota nyingine na kufanya utafiti kwenye nchi nyingine, wengine wanaamini kwamba wengine wanaishi kwenye nyota nyingine au nchi nyingine. Lakini, ikiwa hivi hivyo itakapotokea, hata hivyo, haitakapotokea kwa muda mrefu. Nyota zinazozunguka zimejaa kwa wingi sana, kiasi kwamba kuna trili zaidi ya milia kati ya nyota zinazotembea kwa kawaida. Kama wewe utakapotokea, wazazi wako wakubwa watakuwa wakifurahia kwenye nchi ya wengine wanaoishi, wakikumbuka wazazi wao wakubwa?"
ref: Watu wengi huota kuhusu siku ambayo wanadamu wanaweza kusafiri kwa nyota nyingine na kuvumbua ulimwengu mwingine. Watu wengine hushangaa ni nini iko huko nje, wengine wanaamini kuwa wageni au maisha mengine yanaweza kuishi kwenye sayari nyingine. Lakini, iwapo hili litawahi kutokea labda halitatokea kwa muda mrefu sana. Nyota zimetawanyika sana kiasi kwamba kuna matrilioni ya maili katikati ya nyota ambazo ni “majirani”. Pengine siku moja, vitukuu wako watasimama juu ya ulimwengu wa kigeni wakiwaza kuhusu mababu zao wa zamani?

src: "The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth that you can stand on. The whole Sun is made out of gases, fire, and plasma. The gas becomes thinner as you go farther from the center of the Sun. The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means ""ball of light""."
mt: "Jua haina kifua kama dunia ambako unaweza kushika. Jua kote ni chafu, moto na plasma. Chafu huchukua wingi wakati wa kufika kwa kwanza kwa kwanza kwa kwanza kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa kwanja kwa
ref: Jua halina ganda gumu kama Dunia ambayo unaweza kusimama kwayo. Jua zima limetengenezwa kwa gesi, moto, na gesi ya utegili. Gesi huwa nyembamba kadiri unavyosonga mbali na Jua. Sehemu ya nje tunayoona tunapotazama jua inaitwa photosphere, kumaanisha “mpira wa mwanga”.

src: About three thousand years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just as the moon does. Phases happen because only the side of Venus (or of the Moon) facing the Sun is lighted. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets go around the Sun. Then, a few years later in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.
mt: Kama milioni mitatu baada ya hayo, mwaka 1610, astronomi wa Italia Galileo Galilei alitumia kamera ya anga kufanya utafiti kwamba Venus ina majina, kama mwezi. Majina hayo yanasababishwa na kwamba kila wakati kundi la Venus (au la mwezi) ambalo lipo karibu na anga linaangaliwa. Majina ya Venus yalivuta teoria ya Copernicus kwamba dunia zinapita anga. Kisha miaka miwili baada ya hayo, mwaka 1639, astronomi wa Uingereza Jeremiah Horrocks alitumia kamera ya anga kufanya utafiti wa Venus.
ref: Takribani miaka elfu tatu baadaye, mnamo 1610, Mnajimu Muitaliano Galileo Galilei alitumia darubini kuangalia kwamba Zuhura ina awamu, kama vile mwezi. Awamu hufanyika kwa sababu tu upande wa Zuhura (au wa Mwezi) unaoegemea upande wa Jua hupata mwanga. Awamu za Zuhura ziliunga mkono nadharia ya Kopernikasi kwamba sayari zinazunguka Jua. Kisha, miaka michache baadaye mwaka wa 1639, mnajimu Mwingereza aliyeitwa Jeremiah Horrocks alitazama safari ya Venus.

src: The Amazon River is the second longest and the biggest river on Earth. It carries more than 8 times as much water as the second biggest river. The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times six miles wide. A full 20 percent of the water that pours out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon. The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.

Amazon ni pia mto mwenye kipimo kikubwa zaidi duniani, kwa mara nyingi kipimo chake kimepanda zaidi ya kilomita 6. Maji yote ya mto huu yamejengwa kwa maji ya miji mingi zaidi ya 1000. ref: Mto wa Amazon ndiyo mto wa pili kwa urefu na kubwa zaidi Duniani. Inachukua maji zaidi ya mara 8 kama mto wa pili mkubwa. Amazon pia ni mto mpana zaidi Duniani, wakati mwingine maili sita kwa upana. Asilimia 20 kamili ya maji ambayo yanatoka kwenye mito ya sayari kuenda ndani ya bahari hutoka kwenye Amazoni. Mto mkuu wa Amazon una kilomita 6,387 (maili 3,980). Hukusanya maji kutoka maelfu ya mito midogo.

src: Eighteen percent of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who are employed work in the informal economy. Two thirds of Venezuelans who work do so in the service sector, nearly a quarter work in industry and a fifth work in agriculture. An important industry for Venezuelans is oil, where the country is a net exporter, even though only one percent work in the oil industry.
mt: Kabla na kufikia 2010, 18% ya Wavenezuela waliokuwa wajitahidi, na wengi wao waliokuwa wajitahidi waliwahi kufanya kazi katika kiwanda cha kawaida. Thuluthi mbili ya Wavenezuela ambao hufanya kazi hufanya hivyo katika sekta ya huduma, karibu robo yao hufanya kazi katika viwanda na humusi hufanya kazi katika kilimo. Thuluthi mbili ya Wavenezuela ambao hufanya kazi hufanya hivyo katika sekta ya huduma, karibu robo yao hufanya kazi katika viwanda na humusi hufanya kazi katika kilimo. Sekta muhimu kwa Wavenezuela ni mafuta, ambapo nchi hiyo ni wauzaji nje, ingawa ni asilimia moja tu wanaofanya kazi katika sekta ya mafuta.

src: Stars give off light and heat because of the energy made when hydrogen atoms are merged (or fused) together to form heavier elements. Scientists are working to create a reactor that can make energy in the same way. This, however, is a very hard problem to solve and will take many years before we see useful fusion reactors built.
mt: Ziwani zinaanza kutoka na kupata nuru na nyota kwa sababu ya nishati inayotokana na kushirikiana (kutengeneza) atomi za hidrojeni kwa kuunda elementi zaidi za kati. Wanasayansi wanaendesha kazi ya kutengeneza reaktor ambao anaweza kutengeneza nishati kwa njia hiyo. Hii, kwa vile ni maswala mengi yanayohitaji kuzingatia, ni suala kubwa sana kwa kufikia kile ambacho tutaweza kutengeneza reaktor zinazotumia nishati kama vile hivyo.
ref: Nyota hutoa mwangaza na joto kwa sababu ya nishati inayotengenezwa wakati atomu za hidrojeni zinapochanganywa (au kuunganishwa) pamoja ili kuunda elementi nzito. Wanasayansi wanashugulika kuunda tanuri la kinyuklia ambalo linaweza kutengeneza nishati kwa njia hiyo hiyo. Hii, hata hivyo, ni shida ngumu sana kutatua na itachukua miaka mingi kabla ya matanuri ya kufaa ya kinyuklia kuundwa.

src: Elements and compounds can move from one state to another and not change. Nitrogen as a gas still has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. The liquid state is denser but the molecules are still the same. Water is another example. The compound water is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. It has the same molecular structure whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid. Although its physical state may change, its chemical state remains the same.
mt: Elementi na madhara yanaweza kuondoka kwa moja kwa moja na hawachanganyiki. Nitrogeni kama gasi bado ina vipimo vingine vya liquid nitrogeni. Hali ya kudondoka ni kubwa lakini molekuli zake zinaendelea kuwa zile. Maji ni mfano mwingine. Madhara ya maji ni yale ya miti tatu ya hidrojeni na mmoja ya oksijeni. Ina mifumo ya molekuli moja kama ni gasi, maji, au kati. Wala hata hivyo hali yake kemia inabaki sawa.
ref: Elementi na misombo zinaweza kusonga kutoka hali moja hadi nyingine na zikose kubadilika. Nitrojeni kama gesi bado ina sifa sawa na nitrojeni oevu. Hali oevu nzito kiasi lakini molekyuli bado ni sawa. Maji ni mfano mwingine. Msombo maji umeundwa kwa atomu mbili za hidrojeni na atomu moja ya oksijeni. Ina muundo sawa wa kimolekyuli iwe ni gesi, kioevu, au mango. Ingawa hali yake ya mwili inaweza kubadilika, hali yake ya kikemikali inabaki ile ile.

src: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation. Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts. It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states. The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.
mt: Katika vita ya mapinduzi, majimbo sita kwanza yalichapisha chama kisichokwenda kwa nguvu—kwa Bunge kuwa sehemu yake pekee—kwa kipindi cha maktaba ya kifedha cha kiswahili. Bunge hakikuwa na nguvu yoyote ya kuchukua kodi, na, kwa sababu hakikuwa na utawala wa kiongozi au kisheria, lilishitakiwa kwa utawala wa vikali, wakati wengi wao wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wakati wak
ref: Wakati wa Vita vya Mapinduzi, majimbo kumi na matatu kwanza yaliunda serikali dhaifu ya kati – huku Bunge la Marekani likiwa ndiyo sehemu yake pekee – chini ya Vifungu vya Shirikisho. Kongamano lilikosa uwezo wowote wa kuweka ushuru, na, kwa sababu hakukuwa na mtendaji wa kitaifa au mahakama, lilitegemea mamlaka ya taifa, ambao mara nyingi hawakuwa na ushirikiano, kutekeleza sheria zake. Pia haikuwa na mamlaka ya kupuuza sheria na orodha za ushuru kati ya majimbo. Vifungu vilihitaji ridhaa ya pamoja kutoka kwa majimbo yote kabla ya kurekebishwa na majimbo yalichukulia serikali kuu kwa mzaha sana kiasi kwamba mara nyingi wawakilishi wao hawakuwepo.

src: "If you have watched the movie National Treasure, you may think a treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence. However, that is not true. Although there is something written on the back of the document, it is not a treasure map. Written on the back of the Declaration of Independence were the words ""Original Declaration of Independence dated 4th July 1776"". The text appears on the bottom of the document, upside down. While no one knows for certain who wrote it, it is known that early in its life, the large parchment document (it measures 29¾ inches by 24½ inches) was rolled up for storage. So, it is likely that the notation was added simply as a label."
mt: "Kama umekuwa unavyoangalia filamu ya National Treasure, unaweza kuelewa kwamba ramani ya dhahabu ilikuwa imeandikwa kwa mstari wa kwanza wa Mwongozo wa Uhuru. Lakini hilo si kweli. Hata hivyo, kuna kitu kimeandikwa kwa mstari wa kwanza wa Mwongozo wa Uhuru, lakini si ramani ya dhahabu. Kwa mstari wa kwanza wa Mwongozo wa Uhuru, kuna maneno "Original Declaration of Independence dated 4th July 1776". Maneno hayo yanasemekana kwa mstari wa kwanza wa Mwongozo wa Uhuru, kwa mstari wa kwanza. Hakuna yeyote anayejua kwa nini yalikuwa yameandikwa, lakini yalikuwa yameandikwa kwa sababu kwanza Mwongozo wa Uhuru ulikuwa umewekwa kwa mstari wa kwanza, kwa mstari wa kwanza. Kwa sababu Mwongozo wa Uhuru ulikuwa umewekwa kwa mstari wa kwanza, kwa mstari wa kwanza, kuna nia ya kuweka kifaa cha kuzingatia kwa mstari wa kwanza, kwa mstari wa kwanza. Kwa sababu Mwongozo wa Uhuru ulikuwa umewekwa kwa mstari wa kwanza, kwa mstari wa kwanza, kuna nia ya kuweka kifaa cha kuzingatia kwa mstari wa kwanzi, kwa mstari wa kwanza. Kwa sababu Mwongozo wa Uhuru ulikuwa umewekwa kwa mstari wa kwanza, kwa mstari wa kwanza, kuna nia ya kuweka kifaa cha kuzingatia kwa mstari wa kwanza, kwa mstari wa kwanza. Kwa sababu Mwongozo wa Uhuru ulikuwa umewekwa kwa mstari wa k
ref: Iwapo umetazama sinema ya Hazina ya Kitaifa, huenda ukafikiri ramani ya hazina iliandikwa nyuma ya Tangazo la Uhuru. Hata hivyo, hilo si kweli. Ingawa kuna kitu kilichoandikwa nyuma ya hati, si ramani ya hazina. Nyuma ya Tangazo la Uhuru kuliandikwa maneno “Tangazo halisi la Uhuru la tarehe 4 Julai 1776”. Maandishi hayo yako katika sehemu ya chini ya hati, juu chini. Wakati hakuna anayejua kwa hakika ni nani aliyeiandika, inajulikana kwamba hati hiyo kubwa ya ngozi (ina vipimo vya inchi 29¾ kwa inchi 24½) ilikunjwa kwa uhifadhi. Kwa hivyo, kuna uwezekano kuwa nukuu liliongezwa liwe kama ishara.

src: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.
mt: Awali katika uhuru wa nchi, uwezo wa Singapore Botanic Gardens ulihusika katika kubadilisha kisiwa hicho kuwa mji wa kivikali. Mwaka 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, hybridi ya orchid, ilichaguliwa kuwa dhamana ya nchi.
ref: Mapema katika uhuru wa nchi, utaalamu wa Singapori katika Bustani za Mimea uliisaidia katika kukigeuza kisiwa hicho kuwa Mji wa Bustani wa kitropiki. Mnamo 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, okidi mseto, lilichaguliwa kama ua la kitaifa la nchi hiyo.

src: Although pyramid-building in stone continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza were never surpassed in their size and the technical excellence of their construction. New Kingdom ancient Egyptians marvelled at their predecessors monuments, which were then well over a thousand year old.
mt: Wakati wa ujenzi wa mabaki ya Misri ya Kale, ujenzi wa mabaki ya Misri ya Kale ulikuwa unavyoendelea hadi mwisho wa Misri ya Kale, lakini mabaki ya Misri ya Kale ya Giza yalitupwa na wakati wao na uwezo wao wa kujenga.
ref: Ingawa ujenzi wa piramidi kwa mawe uliendelea hadi mwishoni mwa Ufalme Mzee, piramidi za Giza hazikuwahi kupitwa katika saizi yazo na ubora wa kiufundi wa ujenzi wazo. Wamisri wa kale wa Ufalme mpya walishangazwa na minara ya watangulizi wao, ambayo ilikuwa wakati huo na zaidi ya miaka elfu.

src: Every year around October nearly 1.5 million herbivores travel towards the southern plains, crossing the Mara River, from the northern hills for the rains. And then back to the north through the west, once again crossing the Mara river, after the rains in around April. The Serengeti region contains the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.

Kisha tena kurudi kaskazini kupitia magharibi, na kuvuka mto Mara mara nyingine tena, baada ya mvua karibu Aprili. src: With the battle for France over, Germany began to get ready to invade the island of Britain. Germany code-named the attack “Operation Sealion”. Most of the British Army's heavy weapons and supplies had been lost when it evacuated from Dunkirk, so the army was fairly weak. But the Royal Navy was still much stronger than the German Navy (“Kriegsmarine”) and could have destroyed any invasion fleet sent across the English Channel. However, very few Royal Navy ships were based near the likely invasion routes as the admirals were afraid they would be sunk by German air attack.
mt: Baada ya vita kwa Ufaransa kufika kuelekea, Ujerumani kuanza kutayarisha kufika kwenye kisiwa cha Uingereza. Ujerumani kinaajili kufanya mapigano huo “Operation Sealion”. src: With the battle for France over, Germany began to get ready to invade the island of Britain. Germany code-named the attack “Operation Sealion”. Most of the British Army's heavy weapons and supplies had been lost when it evacuated from Dunkirk, so the army was fairly weak. But the Royal Navy was still much stronger than the German Navy (“Kriegsmarine”) and could have destroyed any invasion fleet sent across the English Channel. However, very few Royal Navy ships were based near the likely invasion routes as the admirals were afraid they would be sunk by German air attack.

src: "Let's start with an explanation about Italy's plans. Italy was mainly the ""little brother"" of Germany and Japan. It had a weaker army and a weaker navy, although they had just built four new ships right before the beginning of the war. Italy's main goals were African countries. To capture those countries, they would need to have a troop launching pad, so as troops could sail across the Mediterranean Sea and invade Africa. For that, they had to get rid of British bases and ships in Egypt. Besides those actions, Italy's battleships were not supposed to do anything else. Now for Japan. Japan was an island country, just like Britain."
mt: "Tafadhali tafute maelezo juu ya mapendekezo ya Italia. Italia ilikuwa kama ndugu mdogo wa Ujerumani na Japan. Ilikuwa na jeshi la chini na jeshi la bahari la chini, wakati wao walikuwa wamejenga magari mawili mpya kabla ya mwanzo wa vita. Mapendekezo ya Italia yalikuwa Afrika. Kwa kuwakamua nchi hizo, wao watahitaji kwa kushinda makao ya Uingereza na magari ya bahari katika Misri. Kwa ajili hiyo, wao watahitaji kushinda magari ya bahari ya Italia. Kwa sasa juu ya Japan. Japan ni nchi ya kisiwa, kama Uingereza."
ref: Hebu tuanze na maelezo kuhusu mipango ya Italia. Italia ilikuwa hasa “kaka mdogo” wa Ujerumani na Japani. Ilikuwa na jeshi dhaifu na nevi dhaifu, ingawa walikuwa wamejenga tu meli nne mpya kabla ya kuanza kwa vita. Malengo makuu ya Italiano yalikuwa nchi za Kiafrika. Ili kunasa nchi hizo, walihitaji kuwa na pedi ya kurushia vikosi, ili vikosi viweze kusafiri katika Bahari ya Mediteranea na kuishambulia Afrika. Kwa hayo, walihitaji kuondoa kambi na meli za Uingereza kutoka Misri. Zaidi ya hatua hizo, manowari za Italia hazikupaswa kufanya lingine lolote. Sasa kwa Japani. Japani ilikuwa nchi ya kisiwa, kama vile Uingereza.

src: "The D-Day landings and the following battles had freed the north of France, but the south still wasn't free. It was ruled by the ""Vichy"" French. These were French people who had made peace with the Germans in 1940 and worked with the invaders instead of fighting them. On 15 August 1940, the Allies invaded southern France, the invasion was called ""Operation Dragoon"". In just two weeks the Americans and Free French forces had liberated southern France and were turning towards Germany."
mt: "Kusitisha na mapigano yalikuwa yamepata nchi ya kaskazini ya Ufaransa, lakini kaskazini bado haikupata uhuru. Ilikuwa ikikabidhiwa na Wafaransa waliokabidhiwa na Wajerumani katika mwaka 1940 na kufanya kazi na wakimbizi badala ya kushambulia. Tarehe 15 Agosti 1940, Wajerumani na Wafaransa wafree walivamia kusini mwa Ufaransa, mpango huo ulitajwa kama "Mpango Dragoon". Katika miezi mitatu Wajerumani na Wafaransa wafree walivamia kusini mwa Ufaransa na wakati huo wakavamia Wajerumani."
ref: "Utuaji siku ya shambulio na mapigano yaliyofuata yalikuwa yameweka huru kaskazini mwa Ufaransa, lakini kusini bado haikuwa huru. Ilitawaliwa na Wafaransa wa “Vichy”. Hawa walikuwa watu wa Ufaransa ambao walikuwa wamefanya amani na Wajerumani mnamo 1940 na kufanya kazi na washambulizi badala ya kupigana nao. Mnamo Agosti 15 1940, Majeshi ya Kirafiki yalishambulia Ufaransa kusini, shambulio liliitwa ""Operesheni Dragoon"". Kwa kipindi cha majuma mawili tu vikosi vya Marekani na Ufaransa Huru vilikuwa vimekomboa Ufaransa kusini na vilikuwa vikielekea Ujerumani."

src: Submarines are ships designed to travel underwater, and remain there for an extended amount of time. Submarines were used in World War I and World War II. Back then they were very slow and had a very limited shooting range. In the beginning of the war they mostly travelled on top of the sea, but as radar began developing and becoming more accurate the submarines were forced to go under water to avoid being seen. German submarines were called U-Boats. The Germans were very good at navigating and operating their submarines. Because of their success with submarines, after the war Germans aren't trusted to have many of them.
mt: Ziwani ni majengo yanayotembea chini ya maji, na kuendelea kwa muda mrefu. Ziwani zilitekelewa katika Vita vya Kwanza na Kilio. Hakika zilikuwa zimejaa na kasi chafu, na kasi ya kushika. Kwanza zilikuwa zimejaa juu ya maji, lakini wakati radarika kujaa na kujaa, ziwanizilifukuzwa chini ya maji ili kudhibitiwa. Ziwani za Kijerumani zilijulikana kama U-Boats. Kijerumani walikuwa wabunifu na wakifanya kazi bora kwa ziwaniz. Kwa sababu ya ushindi wao na ziwaniz, baada ya vita Kijerumani hawakubaliwa kwa ziwaniz zaidi.
ref: Sabmarini ni meli zilizoundwa kusafiri chini ya maji, na kubaki hapo kwa muda mrefu. Nyambizi zilitumiwa katika vita vya pili vya dunia. Wakati huo zilisonga polepole sana na zilikuwa na masafa mafupi sana ya upigaji risasi. Mwanzoni mwa vita zilisonga mara nyingi juu ya bahari, lakini kadiri rada ilivyoanza kukua na kupata usahihi zaidi nyambizi zililazimika kuzama chini ya maji ili kuepuka kuonekana. Manowari za Ujerumani ziliitwa nyambizi. Wajerumani walikuwa wazuri sana kwa kuabiri na kuendesha manowari zao. Kwa sababu ya mafanikio yao na nyambizi, baada ya vita Wajerumani hawaaminiki kuwa na nyingi zazo.

src: By September 17, 1939, the Polish defense was already broken, and the only hope was to retreat and reorganise along the Romanian bridgehead. However, these plans were rendered obsolete nearly overnight, when over 800,000 soldiers from the Soviet's Union Red Army entered and created the Belarussian and Ukrainian fronts after invading the eastern regions of Poland in violation of the Riga Peace Treaty, the Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression Pact, and other international treaties, both bilateral and multilateral.
mt: Kwa siku ya 17 Septemba 1939, usalama wa Polandi ilikuwa imepinduliwa, na ushahidi wa kufika kwa kujitolea kwa kufuata mabwawa ya Romania ilikuwa ni tu. ref: Kufikia Septemba 17, 1939, ulinzi wa Kipolishi ulivunjwa, na tumaini la pekee lilikuwa kurudi na kujipanga tena kwa darajakuu la Kiromania. Hata hivyo, mipango hii ilipitwa na wakati usiku mmoja, wakati zaidi ya askari 800,000 kutoka Jeshi Jekundu la Umoja wa Kisovyeti lilipoingia na kuunda mipaka ya Belarusiani na Ukreini baada ya kuvamia maeneo ya mashariki mwa Polandi kwa kukiuka Mkataba wa Amani wa Riga, Mapatano ya Kisovyeti-Polishi Yasiyo ya Uchokozi, na mikataba mingine ya kimataifa, pande mbili na pande nyingi.

src: Things did not go well for the Italians in North Africa almost from the start. Within a week of Italy's declaration of war on June 10, 1940, the British 11th Hussars had seized Fort Capuzzo in Libya. In an ambush east of Bardia, the British captured the Italian Tenth Army's Engineer-in-Chief, General Lastucci. On June 28, Marshal Italo Balbo, the Governor-General of Libya and apparent heir to Mussolini, was killed by friendly fire while landing in Tobruk.

ref: Mambo hayakwenda vizuri kwa Waitaliano katika Afrika Kaskazini tangu karibu mwanzoni. Ndani ya wiki tangu Italia kutangaza vita mnamo Juni 10, 1940, Hussar wa 11 wa Kiingereza walikuwa wameteka Ngome ya Kapuzo huko Libya. Katika shambulizi mashariki mwa Bardia, Wazungu walimkamata Mhandisi Mkuu wa Jeshi la Kumi la Kiitaliano, Jenerali Lastucci. Mnamo Juni 28, Marshal Italo Balbo, Gavana Mkuu wa Libya na mrithi dhahiri wa Mussolini, aliuawa kimakosa alipokuwa akitua huko Tobruk.

Within a week of Italy's declaration of war on June 10, 1940, the British 11th Hussars had seized Fort Capuzzo in Libya. In an ambush east of Bardia, the British captured the Italian Tenth Army's Engineer-in-Chief, General Lastucci. On June 28, Marshal Italo Balbo, the Governor-General of Libya and apparent heir to Mussolini, was killed by friendly fire while landing in Tobruk.
